description:
What an awesome gem of the city-

Always fresh and always the best tasting everything.

I've been coming here for 20+ years and the 2 families that run this business know there food.

If you love oyster and escargot then enjoy a glass of wine or beer and enjoy ordering more. 

Best place to take a cable car and jump off right out front- 

Enough good things can't be said about this place.

My mother in law is allergic to fish and still loves the menu with several non fish items available.

Enjoy-
author: L T.

description:
1) Old oysters NOT fresh at all, sauce that came with also very salty. 
2) Food very oily. 
3) Service is bad and slow, not even busy night. 
4) too experience compare to quality of the food. 
5) I would NOT recommend anyone to order key lime pie. 

It just not good. Spend your money somewhere else.
author: Fah Z.

description:
4.5 STARS

I've been trying to get together a group of friends for some time. Finally on Friday, March 9th, we made it happen. I made a reservation for dinner at Hyde Street Seafood House through OpenTable about a week prior for a party of five at 6pm.

Happy Hour is 5pm-7pm, so luckily, we made it in time for $1.25 oysters! You do have to order them by the dozen at $15 a pop. The oysters come with mignonette and cocktail sauce. (Note: You can sit at a table and order their HH specials, so feel free to make a reservation if you want to guarantee yourself a table.) With our group, we were able to finish three dozen. That night, they were offering: Skookum (BC), Quilcene (Wa), Hammersley (Wa). I'm into smaller oysters since I find them sweeter and cleaner tasting, so my favs were the Hammersley. We ended up getting two dozen of all varieties and one dozen of just those. For HH, they also have $4 draft pint beers and $1 off certain glasses of wine. We just stuck to bottles of wine, so didn't take advantage of the drink specials.

*Seafood Salad: mixed greens with fresh crab meat, bay shrimp & smoked salmon ($16)
*New England Clam Chowder ($9)
*Lobster Bisque ($10)
*Escargot with garlic herb butter ($13)
*Sauteed Mussels with fresh herb butter, onion & white wine ($14)
*Shellfish Combination En Papillote: mussels, clams, scallops & prawns baked in parchment paper with fresh herbs, julienned vegetables, potatoes, white wine, butter & lemon ($25)
*Garlic Roasted Prawns: served with rice or thyme roasted potatoes & vegetables ($23)
*Pan Roasted Corvina Sea Bass: served with scaloppini potatoes, vegetables & kalamata olives, tomato, basil garlic sauce ($25)
*Fettuccini Pasta: with rock shrimp, bay scallops, smoked salmon & chardonnay cream sauce ($25)

We did our whole dinner family style, so shared everything. I always need some kind of vegetable, so the salad was a great palate cleanser of sorts. Since more than half our group wasn't eating meat, we kept everything seafood centric. I adored the pasta. The cream sauce was so comforting and there was a good amount of seafood. I'm a huge fan of garlic butter, so I enjoyed the escargots. Make sure to dip the complimentary bread in the extra butter. So good! The garlic prawns were also super tasty. Meaty with great flavor. I think my least fav dish was the en papillote, but I'm actually not a huge fan of this style of cooking. We just decided to order it since it was a signature dish of theirs. It's good to note, for those not eating meat, the clam chowder does not have any bacon in it. I made sure to ask before ordering.

*Chocolate Cheesecake ($7.50)
*Creme Brulee ($7.50)
*Secret Coffee: topped with whipped cream and shaved chocolate ($6)
*Presidential Tawny Porto: matured in wood for ten years ($10.50)
*Taylor Fladgate Tawny Porto: matured in wood for twenty years ($12)
*Prosecco Extra Dry La Marca DOC, Italy N/V ($39)
*Cabernet Sauvignon Kunde Estate Grown, Sonoma Valley, 2013 ($43)
*Petite Sirah Michael-David, Lodi, 2015 ($50)

To end our meal, we decided to get two desserts. I just had a bite or so of each as the port was basically my dessert. I did enjoy the 20 over the 10 year. I believe the secret coffee had some alcohol in it, but I had a fair amount to drink by the end of dinner, so not 100% sure. For wine, we actually stuck to three bottles. Started with the bubbly for the oysters, the cab for the apps, and the petite sirah for the entrees. They all paired nicely since we're all red wine drinkers. And all bottles were reasonably priced.

Service was amazing! Our waiter was awesome. We were actually here for over four hours and never felt rushed. Even though we closed out the restaurant. A great, very affordable neighborhood restaurant. With all the food and drinks plus tax and tip, we each paid under $100. That's a win in my book!
author: Elena N.

description:
Im actually so lucky to even still be alive after the food poisoning I received from this restaurant. If there was a 0 star option, I would absolutely give that. 
I ordered oysters and was so excited to receive them. Ive been eating oysters literally for 11 years and never have gotten poisoned by them. I woke up around 1am with extreme stomach pains followed by projectile vomiting for no less than 3 hours. I was unable to leave the bathroom floor as I felt like my insides were coming out. All for me to realize later that it was the OYSTERS from this place that had caused my demise. I know there are plenty of food poisoning cases on the West Coast but I was giving it a chance at this place. Never again. I have been sick my entire time here(3 days) and have them to thank for it. Its a shame.
author: Melly A.

description: Ordered for takeout from Uber Eats. Can't believe how overpriced it is for the tiny portions. A small piece of salmon with 2 shrimps and a few sad veggies is $26? See picture. It's laughable. Taste was also really oily. Avoid!
author: Tina G.

description:
Surprised my partner for Valentine's Day.  Arrived at 8pm for our reservation.  Didn't get our appetizer (Caesar salad & 1/2 dozen oysters) until 8:30pm.  Everyone else is complaining, asking for their food.  It is now 9:20pm and we have not received our main course.  Some people have left.  Took a peek in the kitchen, there are 3 people in the kitchen and cannot manage.

This whole pre fix meal is $64/person.  Never coming back here.
author: Christian B.

description: Came here with a friend, she had actually picked out the place. The food was overall fresh and tasty but too pricey for what it is. I've attached a photo of the pan fried sole.
author: Inci A.

description:
Old school seafood restaurant that has a distinctly mom-and-pop feel to it which is pretty enduring. Go elsewhere if you're expecting something fancy. 

Think choice of fish en papillote. Simple, homey, but keeps the fish nice and moist. The classic San Franciscan cioppino is on the menu of course. But the 5-7pm happy hour special is pretty great. A dozen oysters for $15. They were plump and fresh. It's so nice to enjoy a platter of oysters with an ice cold chalice of Stella. 

Compared to other more contemporary spots, it feel dated but there's an honesty to Hyde Street Seafood House And Raw Bar that is really nice. That and a the happy hour special.
author: Jon L.

description: Ordered with Uber Eats tonight, everything about the food was spot on....Thank you Hyde Street Seafood!
author: Dave P.

description:
Made a Yelp Reservation and got a great seat. They had a great specials menu so our table got a dozen oysters, two ahi tuna dishes and I got the lobster ravioli. Everyone literally cleaned their plates, they were all delicious and really great portions. I always worry about getting ravioli cause sometimes people only give like...five pieces with barely any meat in it. This dish was stacked, and even outside of the ravioli, there was extra meat in the sauce. It was so good!

Our waitress was so nice and took very good care of us. She frequently checked in, was able to bump up appetizer dishes to full dinner dishes, and answered all questions. The restaurant itself was really nice, and clean. Can't wait to go again!
author: Kristen T.

description: We came for oysters during happy hour on a Friday, and although the scene was dead quiet, the food was awesome. The nicest and cutest Asian couple runs the place, and took really good care of us. We each ordered a dozen oysters, which was 15 bucks each. Although You can find dollar oysters in the city, these we much more sizable than other places in the city. The drinks were also on point, and the place is in a pretty sweet location right along the trolley tracks in Nob Hill. Great place for a date or romantic night
author: Ross S.

description:
Please visit this seafood house!!!the food is wonderful and never disappoints. This is by far my favorite restaurant ever! 
Love the ambiance and the staff.. always amazing
author: Mary K.

description: Wonderful food. Very nice server. Had the fettuccine with seafood and it was declined. So was the Alaskan Halibut in Pappalote.
author: scott o.

description:
Don't go here.

The only good thing about this spot was the (off the menu, not at all promoted) special of a dozen oysters for about $1 each.

Service was some of the worst I've ever had. No joke.

[For reference most of my review ratings are 4 stars and above, 2 stars are rare]
author: Rachel R.

description:
Always amazing. My fav romantic Russian Hill restaurant.  All the seafood is cooked to perfection. You'll be happy with anything you order, but make sure to get the lobster bisque!!! Super creamy and delightful. 

An intimate spot any night of the week. I know this place gets packed on weekends but when visiting on weekdays I've never waited for a table.
author: Tara C.

description: Went there this evening when trying to go to the French place next door.  This place was quiet, elegant, great service, and excellent food.  Will definitely be back.
author: Joe E.

description:
I would give negative stars if I could. Worst service I've ever had in San Francisco and food is sub-par. We had reservations at 7pm and promptly arrived. Ignored by host. Another host seats us. We wait 25 mins for a server and order everything since clearly we might not get another chance. Drinks arrive 15 mins later. They bring appetizers and it's wrong so they take them back. It's now 7:45. No food. 8:15 our appetizers arrive. Crab cakes have shell and are burnt.  We remind them over and over again about our main. 
No main dish and it's now 8:45. 
The manager is apologetic and her consolation is comping 2 drinks. It's ridiculous. I ask to comp the entire meal. She says no. She finally agrees to comp 1 meal and 2 drinks. 
Steak was over cooked. 
The worst dining experience. Do not recommend.
author: Angela F.

description:
I am not sure how this place had such a high rating, we should have walked away when we noticed nearly no one inside 
- the scallops were over cooked, 
- potatoes under cooked, 
- fish was fair though tasteless.
- 0 points for presentation- crab cocktail was a lump of meat thrown on a plate with sauce on the side

Overall disappointing, my best guess is that there was a change of management perhaps - i would not recommend this place to anyone unless they dropped prices in half
author: John-Paul L.

description: Beware of this place. I got Food poisoning from the oysters.  The place is old, needs a cleaning, the service was weird, and I had to ask for my food after ordering....I was one of three tables in there. Skip it.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I was up in SF visiting a friend for the Fourth of July weekend. We decided to dine in for some seafood. 

We ordered clam chowder, lobster bisque, mussels, sea bass, and fettuccine. The lobster bisque and mussels is a must get at this restaurant. However, all others fell quite short. SF is known for their clam chowder but honestly Boudin Sourdough Clam Chowder and Chowders at pier 39 tasted much much better for me. Sea bass was little on the drier side and fettuccine was just plain okay. Overall, just okay food

As with any of my restaurant reviews, I always input service as part of my review. Service and friendliness is at bare minimum. I used to be a waitress myself for two years so I know what bare minimum looks like. They weren't mean or anything but they also didn't want to be bothered. 

I am not a oyster fan but they do have good happy hour deals.
author: Julia HR L.

description: The food was good but the service was so so. The waiter kept asking us if we were rrady to order when we just sat down and needed to settle a baby. We hardly had the time to look at the menu and it wasnt like the restaurant had a line up. There is no baby facility. All they had was a small table to change diaper that hardly hold the length of a baby.
author: Cin D L.

description: Really impressed with the fresh seafood and the excellent service. I also love the decor, it feels cozy. It's near plenty of wine bars so you can make a lovely evening out of it. Will return for sure!
author: E. N.

description:
They were nice enough and the chowder was good, but their oysters gave me terrible food poisoning. I've been sick now for two full days and had to go to the hospital. So either they're not handling their food properly, or they're buying bad shellfish. 

I know it had to be them, because it was the meal I ate right before feeling sick, and I was the only one who had the oysters. Super not happy.
author: Kristina M.

description:
San Francisco has me feelin some kinda way and I always seem to crave oysters when I'm in town. It could be the smell of the ocean in the air? IDK. I yelped Oyster bar and Hyde Street Seafood House and Raw Bar felt like a good choice. The main draw for me was the Happy Hour Oysters priced at $15 for a dozen (5-7pm)! Anyone in the city who loves oysters knows that's a damn good deal!!

The hubs and I were staying at the Hilton in Union Square and decided to walk to dinner since it was a mile away. Not too sure that was a great idea. A mile anywhere else would have been easy peasy, but a mile in SF could be taking you up several inclines that will leave you breathless and a little sweaty. Down hill was by no means any easier. By the time we reached the restaurant we built up an appetite for dinner. This excursion was just supposed o be about appetizers and small plates, but what the hell... we made it there! We might as well enjoy ourselves. We of course took Lyft to get back.  

What we ordered:

1. 2 Dozen Oysters: It was $15 and the when the waiter asked us if we wanted another dozen we were weak to his suggestion. Plus it was like 5 minutes to 7pm and we've already had some wine and between the ambiance of the space and the delicious first dozen it was hard to say no.

2. Escargot: I don't think there is a restaurant in Sacramento (our home base) that offers escargot, and when we saw it on the menu we had to have it. Not often do we get that option at a restaurant. Plus, the hubs and I have had it before liked it and wanted to try it again. Pretty tasty! Texture was chewy and it was covered in butter and garlic. 

3. Cioppino: SF is always cold and what better way to warm up then to have some cioppino. I loved how they didn't skimp out on the good seafood.  Large chunks of fish, several pieces of prawns, large scallop, and mussels made it heavy on the protein side. The warm tomato based sauce was flavorful and the noodles were a nice touch!

Great cozy/intimate place for a quiet dinner with someone special.  I think they have a large table for maybe one large party, but other than that, that's all you get.  Tables are close together that you can hear another person's conversation, but you should mind your own business and focus on who you're with and it's not a problem.

I had a great time!  We'd definitely be back. If anything, at least for the happy hour oysters!
author: TRACY R.

description: Tried their lobster bisque and it wasn't to my liking. Too sweet and creamy. Portions were decent and fish was fresh but nothing there that would make me return
author: Kelly W.

description:
Came here solely for the happy hour oysters! $15 for a dozen is such a steal for the city! Kumamotos not included :( The oysters were very fresh and decent sized. Happy hour is 5pm-7pm everyday and there is typically no line on the weekdays!  Aside from the wonderful oysters, the service was tentative and the ambiance was nice. The Cioppino was also good but the portion was pretty small for the price. I think I will stick to just the oysters and beer ($4 during HH) next time. 

P.S. I would not recommend driving here. Nob Hill parking is near impossible.
author: Lynn T.

description: It is a family run small business, proper mom and PA establishment, so you all get some stars for that. I don't know if we went on a bad night, but the service was non existent with only about 8 tables in the house. We had to flag someone down after 20 minutes because we assumed they didn't know we were there. She assured us she knew, and set the ball rolling for sub parties service for the rest of the night. To the point where we got up to fill our own waters after asking twice for a refill. They push the wine and beer more than the water, to the point it is insulting. The food seems to be cheap ingredients and taste nothing special. Looking into the kitchen I saw nothing to disprove my suspicion. Cheap cans of chicken stock, and yellow tubs of butter, please say that is not margarine. For 30 dollar Cioppino you expect more than a small portion of seafood in really bland, tastes like it is out of the bottle marinara sauce. Same goes for the parchment paper salmon, dull. The fettuccine Alfredo with smoked salmon was the winner of the table, but by no means something I would ever come back for.
author: Oliver B.

description: Had crab and lobster, kinda of expensive. The shells are stick, hard to peel. I don't know it's because they are overbooked or they are not fresh. Anyway, I won't go back again, as there is not anything special. I can cook much better than their chef.
author: Song G.

description:
Old-timey and warm feel to this restaurant with extremely friendly staff - perfect for date night! It felt like you were dining on a ship in a different era. We came late on a weekend evening and there was no wait.

We missed the 5-7 pm happy hour unfortunately so oysters were the normal price of $13 for 6 (3 large, different varieties). They were soo fresh and delicious! Also got a caesar salad to start for $10 which tasted good but nothing special.

Ordered the local snapper baked in parchment paper ($17) with vegetables. Wow that dish was very flavorful and soaked in delicious sauce from the white wine, butter, and lemon. My boyfriend got the pan fried sole ($19) which was equally good and had similar lemony flavor. You can choose between roasted potatoes or rice for the side.

We were too full for dessert since the entrees were a pretty generous portion size for the price. Overall really liked this restaurant and definitely recommend it!
author: Linda X.

description: Came here with my friend before our concert and we ordered the oyster sampler.  It came with Times bay, Oyster Rock, and one other kind of oysters.  They oysters were very fresh and a great price.  Our bottle of wine was excellent and our entrees were excellent.  He had the clam chowder and bowl of Cioppino .  I had the King Salmon.  I would order all that again. :)
author: Sandra L.

description: Exceptional happy hour deals, and the oysters were fresh and delicious! They had 3 options of oysters to choose from. I loved the staff so much, I couldn't get over how friendly and charming they were! I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Great food, awesome service. The atmosphere is nautical, nothing crazy. But it added to the experience nonetheless. :)
author: Jillian H.

description:
I chose this place because my hubby was craving seafood. He enjoyed his oyster platter and cioppino. He said both were very flavorful. I had the snapper and it was just ok. They don't have a full bar but they serve beer and wine, neither of which I'm a fan of. 
The waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is cozy but on the dark side. They keep the restaurant pretty dimly lit. The tables are small and narrow and close together. There's only street parking and it's along the cable car line so we did a couple of laps around the neighborhood to find parking so unless you're good at squeezing into a space on a hill & parallel parking this place isn't the spot for you. Lol
author: Mar H.

description:
It was good dinner with customer and colleagues.
However, today is St. Valentine's Day, so we didn't have much choices on their menu.
And we surprised they had Japanese oysters on the menu.
We could not imagine we eat Japanese oysters in SF.
author: Koichi S.

description:
This place is great for oysters during happy hour! Its a cute place place to take your SO!

Edit: My girlfriend forgot her purse at the restaurant and they chases us a block and a half to give it back. Being an honest business is always a plus!
author: Chris N.

description: Went for the famed (more like "infamous") happy hour oysters, and were served "spawning oysters" (GROSS!). Eating a spawning oyster won't make you sick, but it's not a pleasant experience, either. When fertile, their texture is soft and creamy (and not in a good way like cheese or ice cream). As water temperatures rise in warmer months, oysters spawn, or release eggs and sperm into the water, so once oysters begin the process, they don't stop.  When we advised the elderly Asian manager ("Madame Gao"), she was very apologetic, but in no way empathetic or professional, and even after shown the nasty substance on the shellfish, had no intention of removing cost from our bill, and no clue of this phenomena. This was quite a shock foe a so-called "Seafood House and Raw Bar", as you easily can tell an oyster is spawning, as spawning oysters look foamy, milky, and even a little slimy. A good restaurant would never serve a spawning oyster. Most places train their staff to spot spawning oysters (or at least they should).  This is obviously NOT a good restaurant! Diners beware!!!
author: Mr. W.

description: Sophia was amazing in serving us and making great recommendations for our seafood dinner. The oysters were fresh and delicious and the lobster bisque is to die for!
author: Tara D.

description: We dine here when we visit this city. Meals are delicious and staff is friendly. I'm giving 5 stars just because I don't like that they charge extra for additional baskets of bread.
author: Y N.

description:
No no no!  Keep walking and go somewhere else.  The cioppino tastes like it came out of a Chef Boyaredee can.  And shellfish tastes like old shoe leather!  The waiter said that all the seafood was fresh but clearly it was not.  I should have sent back my plate but I was too embarrassed.  My friend had a soju cocktail and that was awful, too.  I ordered a small house salad so that I didn't go hungry.  While satisfactory, it was small and simple and at $8.50, no bargain.
Restaurant had no central heat- we sat next to a crummy space heater in back and still we wore our jackets for most of the meal.  For prices like this one expects much more.
Fifteen years ago or so, Hyde Street Seafood House was pretty good.  Not any longer.  With other places that are much better in the neighborhood, why not go elsewhere? I wish I had.
author: Jessica H.

description: A quiet and delicious place for dinner. Found this restaurant on Yelp and it sounded nice. Didn't disappoint with a great atmosphere, quiet location, wonderful service and amazing food. Such a great discovery during our trip to San Francisco!!
author: Colleen W.

description:
Great little spot tucked away on Hyde St (hence the name.) Went in for Happy Hour over the weekend with some friends and had a great time. We ordered quite a few dozens of their $15/dozen oysters which included three different varieties that you got to choose from. (In this case all WA oysters, but not Kumamotos.) The oysters come with all the fixings, and were fresh and delicious. We also got $4 draft beers on the side (all of us went with Spaten), and were served some sour dough bread to go along with the meal. 

The service was great, friendly and attentive, and I'll definitely be back.

Also, weekend happy hours? Yes please.
author: Jane F.

description: Lovely atmosphere and very pleasant staff. However, the service is extremely slow - no fault of the staff; there's just not enough to accommodate a dinner crowd. Stick with the fish. It's what they do best! The appetizers were average.I did enjoy my entree but not enough to return for another meal.
author: Theresa P.

description: I have no idea how this place stays in business. So, so overpriced. Super slow, but well-meaning service. Old interior, bathrooms, etc. Skip this place.
author: Cat L.

description: We came here for happy hour $1 oysters and found big, fresh tasty oysters here! They gave us 3 varieties in the dozen and they were all very good. The service was very friendly as well. The bar we sat at was quiet and we were served promptly. I highly recommend this place and would return.
author: Lauren E.

description:
I don't review too often...but I think this place is great.  Charming...not pretentious as so many restaurants are around here...and if you can get here before 7 on any night, a dozen fantastic oysters for $15 is a pretty good deal.

They do a lot of fish in parchment paper...which is very healthy...and I always get it when 2 dozen oysters is still not enough.

Plus...nice trees and a cable car goes by every once in a while.  Truly a nice SF experience.
author: Gary R.

description:
I'm drawn here for a few great reasons.  And it's only these reasons why I tend to go back and repeat, regardless of how far and how long it takes me to park.  

Their happy hour oysters are no joke.  Quality oysters at such a reasonable price would make anyone order more than just a dozen...and come back for more.  My favorites are the refreshingly sweet Kumamotos and the perfectly briny and smooth Evening Cove Bay Oysters.  
Along with slurping these shelled gems, their Lobster Bisque is a definite must have.  With bits of lobster and an insanely amazing soup flavor, this Lobster Bisque tops all seafood bisques in my book.   

Next time, I'll try not to lick the bowl dry in record time.  I'll also challenge myself to order something different on the menu.  

Life is difficult sometimes.
author: Bobby L.

description: Had a lovely weeknight dinner with my parents here. Nice window booths, not crowded at all. Happy hour still goes from 5-7pm, dozen oysters were delicious. Lobster bisque was very tasty as others have said, and I enjoyed the seafood salad with smoked salmon and crab. Shared the halibut in parchment paper and it was a little healthy for my taste. My mom left an item at the restaurant and they were kind enough to call the next day so we could retrieve it.
author: Lia K.

description:
What a great neighborhood find!

If you just spent the last half an hour trying to find parking around the area, you can feel more relaxed now: nautical touches throughout the resto, friendly staff and a daily happy hour special from 5 - 7pm for $1 oysters. 

That's right. Daily. As in, E V E R Y D A Y! Ogni giorno, quotidien, taglich! 

We were set for the next hour enjoying 3 dozen oysters, lobster bisque and warm French bread.  Their wines by the glass aren't overpriced (get the Sauvignon Blanc and Sparkling Rose) and beers like Anchor Steam, Sierra Nevada, Guiness are available. 

Oysters are one of my favorites and the ones served here are super fresh. I especially love the kumamotos for their sweetness. But I'm sure, whatever you get here will satisfy your craving (and perhaps act as a aphrodisiac as well after dinner?)

Slurp's Up! ;-)
author: Janice C.

description: Had a wonderful 50th birthday dinner here. Food was delicious and service was impeccable. Our server was so attentive; he made us feel like we were the only ones in the restaurant.  Highly recommend this seafood restaurant!
author: Christine M.

description:
The BF and I wanted to have a quiet dinner for our Friday Date Night and I wanted seafood and Yelp threw this out there on my feed. It looked quite quaint and thought, hey, why not??
The atmosphere is very cozy and homey which is exactly what we both wanted. Our server came to us right away and was incredibly welcoming. We ordered a bottle of Syrah and it was very reasonably priced as was their seafood prices. 
Lobster Bisque: MUST HAVE!!!! This was amazing. Please, please, please come here to slurp this amazing soup. 
Truffle Oil Seared Ahi App: It was just okay. However, it was a huge portion for the price; about  12 pieces for $13.
Sea Bass special: ZOMG... stop the boat. Huge portion again and very flavorful. Tony and I couldn't stop making O faces. So good.
I really, really want to promote this restaurant: the service was beyond extraordinary, the decor is warm and inviting and the food is on point. I cannot wait to come back!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Really friendly, nice and helpful! Oysters were very fresh and tasty! Creamy yumm
4 of us got a bit over a dozen per person. And the we decide to share seafood combo and halibut. It was fresh and very light, not oily or fat at all
Creme brûlée to share was just a cherry on top of that amazing dinner!
author: Asiyat T.

description: I don't get it. Completely mobbed. Menu does not list where fish was sourced so it is probably all farm raised and not local despite prices. Wine list is awful - French food and only really bad French wine. Ice bucket for warm sancerre was crushed no water so could not chill bottle. Ordered very overpriced clams on half shell and kumomotos and they were poorly shucked and swimming in melted ice . served with one sad lemon wedge and too-strong mignonette. Over $3 each piece for low quality. Waited over 40 min for mains to show up. No apology. I ordered house  specialty, shellfish en papillote. One of the clams was rotten. Rest was swimming in butter and just not good. Waiter over worked and stressed and useless. I came here from LA expecting excellent local seafood experience . What a waste of $200.
author: Andrea H.

description:
This is a cute restaurant with an extremely friendly staff. I got the feeing that the owners are front of the house so they are incredibly accommodating.

We ordered the Kumamoto oysters, cioppino, lobster seafood ravioli, Dungeness crab with garlic butter. Dinner was very good and overall a wonderful evening.

The only disappointment was the banana bread pudding which was watery... peculiar. But the vanilla ice cream was fine.
author: Laurie M.

description: Fresh ingredients, friendly and fun staff, quaint ambiance.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Hands down best restaurant I've eaten at in the city.  Heard about it from a bartender down in Ghirardelli where our business meeting was, we asked for a recommendation for "good, authentic seafood" and boy did she deliver. 
This recommendation was given to me 7 years ago and I have yet to be disappointed over at least a dozen meals eaten here.  
It's my go to for birthday dinner, Christmas weekend in the city dinner, basically any excuse to eat in San Francisco and Hyde Street is our jam. 

Do yourself a favor and order the lobster bisque.  I started out helping myself to my partner's bowl, and then I pretty much ate the whole thing. You will not regret ordering it for your appetizer. 

Besides my low key obsession with the lobster bisque, I've tried everything from the little neck clam appetizer, the hot sautéed clam app,  crab cakes, garlic roasted prawn entree, and the garlic roasted Dungeness crab to name my favorites and I have not once been disappointed.   

My best friend and I went here when she was visiting the city and she had the stuffed prawns in a Béarnaise sauce entree and she was thrilled with her meal. 

The staff does a great job being attentive but not on top of you, and the pricing is so so reasonable for a seafood restaurant in the city. 
Lastly the decor is so fun, it's all nautical maps on the walls and decor, and your food comes out from the kitchen in a real porthole! 

I highly recommend Hyde Street Seafood (and my food loyalty is not easily won)!
author: K C.

description:
I really hoped this place was going to be as good as last time I came, which sadly was at least 6 years ago from time of this review, but it was not that great this time around.

I made reservations and we were seated promptly. We ordered the seabass in a paper bag. It was dry and a little tough. The vegetables were good though as well as the sauce. But a place known for it's fish in a bag, how can they mess this up?? My cousin ordered the salmon in the bag and it was fine.

They offered to replace the seabass for us, but service was sooo slow and it was sooo hard to get their attention, we gave up because it was taking so long. At least they comp'd it.

Also, we ordered the salad for 2 and it was sooo simple, we felt that for $10 it was a BIG ripoff. #ripoffAlert. It was just lettuce and a few cut up tomatoes here and there.

The lobster bisque was pretty good but could use a little seasoning.

I don't know if I will go back just based on their slow service and inconsistent food. I really wished it was as a good as before. My reputation as a foodie was on the line and I lost some credit. :(
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Yuk!!!! The food I had was very dry and nasty and for 5 tiny shrimps the guy charged me $27.00. Spoke to Sophia and asked for Manager. She was more concerned to not help me. She was trying to be nosey.  I only bought 5 little shrimps from the seafood house restaurant. This company charged me $27.00 for 5 dried shrimp. The shrimps were awful and the service was a zero. Sophia and the server guy was so rude to me. I will never go back to this establishment again. 
They charged  me too much for their food and the service was unbelievable.  it was a horrible experience for me and I will never recommend my friends or family to come to this place.
author: P P.

description:
By far the worst restaurant experience I've had recently. Portions are small, quality is low, and that might have been passable had the service been excellent. Sadly, it was not. Dinner took well over an hour to arrive after we ordered with no concern from the wait staff. No offers to grab another round of drinks or another basket of bread. 

If a restaurant has last minute seating available at 7:30 on a Saturday night, run, don't walk, the other way. With so many options on Hyde st, or nearby on Polk, go elsewhere!
author: Justin R.

description:
Come for happy hour!!!

you can't beat 12 for $14 delicious, plump, fresh oysters. Seriously. These are awesome and such a good deal.

The dinner menu items I've tried have been okay at best...
I've gotten a special en papillote, which I thought was a little bland.

The stuffed trout was interesting though - it seemed like a crab cake stuffed inside of a filet of trout. Unique flavors, and not too heavy.

Will be back for oysters :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Made it here at 0655pm...JUST in time to still order off of the happy hour menu. We were worried that we were too late since it was so close to 7 but we walked in and were seated right away with the happy hour menu in front of us :) We were seated in the front area at a tiny little table right next to the window. We didn't mind that the table was small because it was just us two in the corner and we weren't squished next to random strangers. 

We got two orders of the dozen oysters ($14 ea!!!) and a bowl of the lobster bisque. The oysters were great...I wish we had gotten one more platter (a little excessive for two people?) and the lobster bisque was super rich and flavorful. 

The happy hour is great here and I will definitely be back for another round of their oysters the next time I'm in town.
author: Tina M.

description:
From the salad to the fish to the stuffed shrimp, the food was decent--just not great. The service was fast and friendly and the atmosphere nice, but I just didn't love the favors enough to compel me to go back.

The sourdough bread had a great crust and the lobster bisque was tasty. I just wanted more of something to beg me to return.

Maybe I had the wrong meals, but it just was an average experience for the price.
author: Kevin H.

description: Some of the freshest oysters for happy hour around for only 15$. The beer is cold, oysters colder , love this place.
author: Justin M.

description: Small, quiet, cozy restaurant with a great menu and service. We stopped in for dinner before a flight and had a wonderful time.
author: Lisa K.

description: I have been coming to this restaurant since I was first introduced to it by a hotel concierge 20 years ago! When ever I am in San Fran, I make a point of dining at this place. The quality is always excellent and the price is very fair and will likely fit if you are travelling with business expense guidelines. Fish done in parchment is their specialty, but this visit was a little different because I had their version of seafood pasta. It was an excellent choice, lots of sea food, clams, mussels, lobster, shrimp & scallop and a great flavorful sauce! For an appetizer, I had the lobster bisque - it was very tasty! All in all a great meal and a great experience!
author: John L.

description: Excellent food but unfortunately service is very bad. Not normal so something must be wrong with staff
author: Marty A.

description: Very disappointed. How do you have "stuffed prawns" with rice serve with white sticky Chinese rice? The "scallops, lobster,crab" did not exist.  The prawns were flattened and baked with a mince of something that had no flavor. Never again.
author: James L.

description: We had an amazing lunch of potato encrusted salmon with a prawn cocktail and clam chowder.   The food was amazing but I had to take one star because the service is very snooty and made us feel unwelcome because we were "cheap" and shared.  Still spent $60!
author: Imogen A.

description:
I stumbled upon this place by accident when my girlfriend and I took a random trip to the city looking for oysters. And what a find this place is! 

They have happy hour everyday from 5-7pm where their mixed dozen oysters are going for $14. That's about $1.17 per oyster and you cannot beat that my friends. Maybe ordering 2 dozen for 2 people is a bit much but it was well worth it. Their lobster bisque is a must have. It is rich and creamy and just excellent! I also ordered the escargot which is served hot and buttery. 

Everything works really well here and I would recommend this place. The ambiance is nice and the servers are attentive. Parking is a bit of a hassle so come early of you have a reservation. 

I will definitely be coming back.
author: Maria D.

description: I finally went!  $14 for 12 assorted oysters everyday from 5-7PM - yes, please!  They were so fresh and tasty -- Add lemon, red vinegar, hot sauce or horseradish - perfect!  I'll be back, oh yes, I will be back!
author: Maile N.

description:
Unbelievably, I was the only patron in the restaurant (9 on a Thursday). A dozen oysters and a bowl of lobster bisque made a great dinner.  A good mix of oysters--fresh, cleanly shucked, relish.  The soup was rich, tasty, and exactly what I wanted.

Super friendly service.  Has a great discussion on my way out about how hard it is for Vietnam-born Cantonese speakers to pick up Mandarin.  I could see this being a regular spot if I lived here.
author: Jon J.

description: I am from Denver and came here. 12 oysters for $15. Soooo good and so fresh! Our waitress Sophia was wonderful!!! Come here and see her. This place is beautiful and has a great setting.
author: Aly G.

description:
Update, I got violent food poisioning from the oysters...so, yeah, maybe not as good as I thought.  


ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW

I went for happy hour to get some oysters.  It's a quaint little restaurant with about a dozen tables and lacks on atmosphere.  If you're thinking happy hour at a crowded bar with some TVs and such...this isn't your place.  It's very quiet.  

It makes up for that in oysters though.  I ended up eating 2 dozen, a basket of sourdough bread, and having 2 Anchor Steams.  My check was $38 after tax.  You can't beat that with a stick.  The oysters they featured were of three varieties; local, Steamboat out of Washington, and Henderson Bay out of Washington.  They were all good but the Washington types were the best.  The Steamboats were huge and the Henderson's were smaller but delicious.  

Outside of happy hour they had a nice looking menu and this would be a good place for a nice dinner date.
author: Mike D.

description: Always outstanding and great courteous service. The wrapped fish is a must have. But honestly you can't go wrong with any of the seafood options
author: Jon S.

description: This place was fantastic. Great atmosphere, food was mouth watering good, service was very hospitable. I will be returning. Don't pass this one up.
author: Carin S.

description:
I came here with a friend from out of town. He really wanted seafood, and I wanted to try something new in the city. So I came here, as I saw the Yelp reviews to be good and all.

We had reservations for 2, and were quickly seated. Service was great. However, the food was meh. We had ordered the following:
1) LOBSTER BISQUE: Would recommend.
2) CIOPPINO SERVED WITH PASTA: I must say, Sotto Mare was a lot better still.
3) DUNGENESS CRAB MORNAY EN CROUTE: Was not a big fan of this...

Overall, I've had better. Sorry.
author: Joanne W.

description:
We liked every bit of it.. oysters were good.. clams good.. lobster bisque we wanted to lick the bowl. Then we shared a nice Pepper Ahi. 

Always looking for those steamed clams..
author: K K.

description:
Neighborhoody feel, quiet place. We usually sit at the bar and get amazing service. Our go to are the oysters and clam chowder. You can't go wrong.
The chardonnay is really good too.
author: Ann B.

description: friendly servers gave good suggestions on what to eat. The parchment cooked salmon was the best I've ever eaten. The stuffed prawns were great too. Excellent food at very reasonable prices. Definitely recommend.
author: Judy G.

description: Love the food and decoration. Recommended by friend...came to try the lobster bisque. MUST HAVE The food there is great but the lobster bisque is a must have. Unlike most lobster bisque's it actually has lobster chunks in it. Happy hour has $1 oysters that are two die for. 5/5 stars and I will come back soon.
author: Sandy L.

description:
I've been to Hyde Street Seafood only 3 times over an 11 year span. I wish I came here more when I had the chance.

Celebrating my last night in my apartment, I chose to go to an old neighborhood staple rather than one of the many new spots in Russian Hill and I'm so glad I did.

The last time I came (2006) I had the garlic shrimp and remembered how good it was for years. This time though, I decided to try something new. 

The sea bass and julienne vegetables with lemon, garlic and white wine cooked in parchment paper was one of the most delicious meals I've ever had.

It's the perfect intimate date spot. Not loud and not a scene at all. *Sit at the window to watch all the cable cars go by.

There is no wonder why this restaurant has been able to withstand 2 recessions and so many years.
author: Lauren C.

description: Such delicious oysters!!! Thank you for the amazing service and delicious beer and oysters!!!
author: Cristian G.

description:
Why it was bad:
First of all the food is bad and the pork chip I ordered was not cooked and the steak was chewy with a coal like taste on the outside also the oysters had this weird metal taste in it also when the brought Out the bread (it was also bad) they forgot to bring the butter so I told one of the waiters that I didn't get any butter they first rolled their eyes then checked my table to see if their was butter than gave me butter after they served 2 other people 
Second of all when I tried to tell one to the waiters that the pork chop was undertook they said wait I am busy and gave the other people their food and walked way the waiter didn't even bother to ask us what the problem was 
Third of all the food takes so long to make and it doesn't taste good sooo there is no point of waiting for the food
Forth of all it wasn't a really friendly atmosphere for me because the waiters seemed like they didn't really care about what I had to say about the food being undercooked but they cared about the other people and gave them fast service and cared about what they had to say
Fifth of all I didn't know where the bathroom was so I asked one of the staff people and they just completely ignored me so I had to find the bathroom myself
And that's why it was bad
author: Fontine D.

description:
Finally came back after many years of disappearance and how I missed the food and the people!

Took my good friend out for dinner in honor of her birthday and it was a good choice for me to do so!

We got there really early that the table that I requested was taken. We opted to seat at the bar to start happy hour. Saw Brian, Johnny, and Sofia (we go way back in the days...) and it was so welcoming that I felt guilty for being MIA. 

I opted to get the soju Cosmo and friend got a glass of white. We also had their famous lobster bisque (still taste the same as ever ~ awesome) and their escargot. She and I shared the bisque with bread so that helped fill us up and allowed us to enjoy more alcohol consumption later on the night... and the escargot, tasty as always as well. Made the friend try one...she was hesitant but still didn't like it but at least she tried one.

We didn't get their famous oysters b/c neither one of us likes them... 

When we finally sat at our table by the window (I requested for it to add to the special occasion!) friend and I were ready to order our entrees. I told her that their specialty is their "en papillote" and so she got the King Salmon and I of course, got their shellfish combo. We also got an order of Kir Royale (we were going to get a bottle but I wouldn't be able to drive thereafter!).

Friend loved her dish since salmon is her fave and me, I was finally able to consume the rest of the my food (first time ever!). 

Dessert: she and I split the creme brulee and the chocolate cheesecake. Both desserts were awesome! 

Service: exceptional! Made my friend feel uber special for her special day and thank you for that!

Will definitely come back... sooner than a couple of years later!
author: Cath M.

description:
Came here with 1 other person and we got a bunch of small dishes to share. The service was slow (perhaps overbooked?) and we saw our waiter infrequently. There were long waits in between receiving dishes, which made this a really slow experience. No apology or discount or anything for wasting 2 hours of our Saturday.

Here's what we got:

1. Oyster special - this was pretty good! A little expensive ($3 per), but the oysters were fresh and came with lemon and balsamic. Yum!

2. Cheese plate - this was terrible - tasted like grocery store cheese for 6x the price. Cheese dishes should do better than craft cheese.

3. Lobster bisque - this was okay. Pretty standard lobster bisque, nothing special.

4. Raw sampler - this came with more oysters and these were less fresh. The clams tasted pretty bad. Also had salmon which was nothing special.

5. Calamari - this was tasteless.

The food ranged from bad/overpriced to meh (except the special oysters), and the service was terribly slow. Would not come here or recommend to anyone else.
author: Emily L.

description:
We were looking for a nice-ish seafood dinner and ended up here after we went to the Swan Oyster Depot and found it to be closed. It was in the neighborhood and still open. It wasn't our first choice, but ended up working out for our vacation date night.

The prices were solid for the amount and quality of the food. We split some fresh oysters and a salad, I had the Dungeness Crab Mornay En Croute, which was decadent and awesome. The beau had the seafood fettuccine, which was "very rich, but tasty". 

Both dishes lacked a punch.
author: Liz G.

description:
tip: escargo @ $10 is a good deal.

Cioppino had spaghetti at the bottom, which was okay.  expected to be bigger portion since it was very pricey.  scallops were good, but had better and bigger.  raw clams and clam chowder were okay, sam's chowder was better.  highlight of the night was the escargo.

ambiance kinda on the dim side.
author: Jacky K C.

description:
Hyde Street Seafood house is located about a mile from the historic Fishermans Wharf. I was traveling on business and was trying to avoid the plethora of overpriced subpar food on the wharf. Basically if you have a restaurant and serve a bowl of clam chowder and some frozen fish you can get $20-$35 a plate because your audience is mostly not ever going to repeat. 

After a mile hike uphill I ordered takeout at Hyde. The process was easy enough although they seemed tired and worn out but polite. The restaurant was half filled, although the half that was filled were lively and seeming to have a good time. I had hope. 

I asked the bartender / slash manager what was local caught and fresh - after all they are a mile away from the ocean so you figure they would take advantage of the their best resource.. Not so much. Exactly two items on their menu were locally sourced. Uh oh, not a good sign. The Ocean and plethora of fresh catch is a MILE AWAY!

I ordered the stuffed rainbow trout and a bowl of clam chowder to go. Rainbow trout is an easy to cook fish that is really hard to screw up unless you overcook it. When I tried a bit of the trout it was soggy and wet, seemingly previously frozen, no shock there. What did shock me was that they didn't de-bone the fish! This is an extremely lazy and amateurish thing to do whisc shows a total lack of preparation and commitment to the safety of their clientele. 

The clam chowder was decent, but I have to investigate if they make it locally or buy it pre-made from a distributor. For now they will get a push on that one. 

The one star comes from a previous frozen fish, their lack of safe food preparation and lack of locally sourced food. I guess in San Francisco if your in a tourist location you have license to offer sub-par food and skip on basic safety like removing pin bones from a fish. 

My advice to the restaurant and most restaurants in the area. Get some passion back. Source some local offerings, pay attention to your clients. It's only so long you can serve crappy food at ZAGAT rated prices. 

I'll be back and hopefully caught them on an off night, but for now the one star stands.
author: Sean G.

description: Great food, wonderful ambience. We especially love the potato encrusted salmon. Sophia is a great hostess. All excellent.
author: Laura F.

description:
Review is only for Happy Hour as I've only had dinner here once and don't remember it. 

Happy Hour here makes me happy. I get a dozen or two oysters, some bread, and a beer and I'm satisfied. It's a dozen oysters for $14, runs from 5-7 daily so those of us who can't get out at 6 on weekdays can still make it, and has three oysters of the day that are usually all pretty good. Draft beers are also discounted.
author: Judy C.

description:
A hole in the wall yet amazing high quality food. 

Will be back again. Had the Mahi Mahi baked in parchment paper as a special -- phenominal!
author: Trevor M.

description:
YOU GOTTA GET THE LOBSTER BISQUE. It is so good. I thought it'd be creamier but I was pleasantly surprised to get little chunks of lobster all throughout my bowl. Oysters tasted fresh, too. And they were so delicious (I LOVE OYSTERS). 

Ordered the Cioppino and had the marinara sauce replaced with a chardonnay cream sauce (not a fan of red sauces) and the dish was delicious. Every bite was followed with a "mmmm, this is so good, TRY IT" and there was plenty of seafood piled onto the plate. The pasta was also al dente (and so good I wish there was more!) 

Our table also ordered the Stuffed Prawns Bearnaise and the King Salmon. The prawns were very tender & succulent (ew, I hate that word ha) and the bearnaise hurt so good. Gotta love butter.. The salmon was also cooked to perfection! Not dry at all. 

We came around 8pm on a Thursday and didn't have to wait at all (although parking was horrendous.. circled around for at least half an hour). Service was attentive & friendly, and our water kept getting refilled without us having to ask for it. Decor was so cute, cozy, and intimate. Pricing wasn't all that steep; delectable dinner for three came out to ~$90 (pre-tip). Def recommend!!!
author: Audrey Y.

description: Best meal I have had in a long time. Shrimp cocktail and then the special that had halibut, scallop, shrimp, cheesy potatoes, and steamed veggies. Avacado and cilantro on the halibut was perfect!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I really wanted to give it a higher rating especially since their lobster bisque is the best I have ever had.  I would give that soup 5 stars.  

As for the rest of our meal, it was just ok.  We had the oyster happy hour special.  You don't get to choose which oysters and some tasted more of the sea than I would have liked.

We order the seabass in parchment paper and the seafood sautee special with prawn, scallops and a fish that taste like butterfish (forgot the name).   
- My husband like the seabass in parchment paper.  It was light and the veggie were good.  I just thought it lacked a little flavor.
- The fish with the seafood sautee was my most favorite and was great
- the prawn and scallops were both overcooked and rubbery (not great at all)  Usually I would have asked them to remake it but didn't feel like going through the hassle. 

The last reason I give it 3 star is the unprofessional behavior of the hostess.  She welcome us and asked if we had reservation.  While she was talking to us, another family came in behind us which she recognized.  She prompted talked to them and proceed to tell them where to sit before she finished helping us.  It just felt very weird.

Overall, I probably wouldn't rush to go back anytime soon
author: Lei H.

description:
*This review is strictly for happy hour only*

I walked in about quarter to 7 on a Friday night - 

I sat down immediately by the door but the friendly lady insisted that I sit in the dining area since it's cold! Okie dokie m'am.

Friend and I shared 2 dozens (originally planned 1... but they disappeared so fast D:), and two glasses of house wine. I probably could've actually done 2 dozens more TBH.

Complimentary bread and butter even during happy hour was a nice touch, it was warm and crispy.

Other menu items sounded delicious and were also pretty reasonably priced for a cute seafood restaurant. And if you're into it, they have soju cocktails (I guess that's like a hip thing nowadays).

I'll be Bach!
author: Alexis P.

description:
This weekend, we made two attempts to eat here.  First, we tried to eat here for lunch...only to find that they don't open until 5PM.  My fault for not paying close enough attention to the business hours.  We tried again the next evening, arriving right at 4:45PM and...success!

The nice lady even let us in a few minutes before the hour, just because she said it would be more comfortable to wait inside.

A variety of seafood items, and even a few non-seafood items, were had.  It was happy hour, so there were three dozen oysters on the table, two of them mine.  The had skookums.  They had marin bays.  They had a third variety whose name I don't recall.  They were all delicious.

I had the clam chowder, which was tasty.  One of my friends had the famous lobster bisque, and it apparently did not disappoint, either.  Delicious cold appetizers?  Seafood soups?  Are you not sold already?

They also have escargot.  I don't eat snails often, but when I do, I like them to be prepared correctly... And these ones were perfect. 

One of the members of our dining party had the swordfish, and another had the stuffed rainbow trout.  I sampled the trout, and it was phenomenal.

For San Francisco, this place is reasonably priced.  Unfortunately, there are just so many appealing items on the menu that it's very difficult not to let things add up on the bill.  But you'll be spending money at a place with quality food, friendly service, and the feel of a neighborhood restaurant.  Sometimes you have to get away from the tourist traps to find the best dining.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Reviewing the daily 4-7pm happy hour.

First time - 5 stars, second time - not so much.

We basically came by only for the $14/dozen oyster happy hour. The first time, the oysters were seriously huge and really fresh. Remember the Fanny Bay was great. Second time, still solid, but not as large.

One thing that bugs me is that whoever shucks the oysters don't do a very good job. Lots of distracting oyster shell bits. -1 star.

Would return but also want to check out other HH spots.
author: Angel L.

description:
Wish I could give no star smh 

Made reservations for Valentine's Day(I'm from out of town) got to the restaurant sat down and found out they only served off a special menu for that day which I didn't mind but when my fiance' and I ordered the lobster tail and filet mignon they said they were out if filet mignon(who does that) HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT. He's going on deployment in early March and this was our last trip together before he leaves. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. We didn't even get the courtesy of a manager or anyone else for that matter come and apologize for the inconvenience and try to accommodate us, so we had to leave and just get pizza since all the other restaurants were booked/full.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
I've only been here once for their oysters.

WOW. This rating is based solely on the quality of oysters and service.  But they were fresh and delicious.  Ordered the sampler platter - twice!

They also serve Spaten beer on tap, which goes well with the oysters.  The bread was ok.

Prices were reasonable for SF & for great quality.
author: Kristeen O.

description:
Woohoo!  Was craving oysters and lo and behold $14 for a batch of 12 during happy hour which runs EVERY DAY 5-7.  

Parking is like the rest of SF, street parking and a bit hard to find but once you're in you can enjoy the history feel of the place and kind service.  As mentioned in other reviews, service is a bit slow but friendly.

Got some oysters and the lobster bisque which was delicious!  They also have a nice choice of wine by the glass.  

Oysters are specialty oysters and much tastier than the $1 oyster at other joints.  Will be back!
author: Esther S.

description:
omg they only have street parking.  what planet are u on in sf.

a heck of a meal.  hey how can you beat great great oysters for $5 a dozen at happyy hour.
service was great.  wine prices were reasonable.  and the food .  omg, like a sexual experience.

so bottom line will we be back .. hell yes
author: John L.

description:
Quite an ordinary place.  I honestly do not know why it gets so many good reviews.  Perhaps it was a bad night for the restaurant.

First of all, the setting is drab.  It's a super old school, divey place, with unframed, paper maps on the walls, and kitchy maritime chach-kas for decor.  Really bad.  Also, the entire restaurant is too brightly lit, and to make matters worse, the light is a dingy yellow, like from dusty old light bulbs, making the place look like a faded sepia print from someone's' attic.

Second - they only serve beer and wine.  Super disappointing.  I should have done my homework so I'll blame myself a little for this but they should really think about a proper liquor license.  Accepting our fate, we ordered a Fume Blanc, which was fine, but kind of pricey for what it was.

Third - the bread was sub-par: papery, bland, institutional in quality, like something you would get in a hospital. I should have seen that as a foretelling of what was to come.

For our meal, we decided to start with some local and adjoining state sourced raw oysters, and those were sublime, but it was all downhill from there.  For a main course,  I ordered seared scallops in a ginger cream sauce with potatoes and string beans.  My companion ordered the sea bass wrapped in parchment, which is evidently a signature dish of the place, with similar starch and veggies.

Then we waited, and waited, and waited. 45 minutes with no other food, except for the overly earnest water boy who kept topping off our water glasses.  Our wine was running low too,  Perhaps this was a tactic to get us to order another $40 bottle of pretty average wine.  We started to notice that other tables were in the same plight.  

Then suddenly, ALL the waiting tables started to receive their orders simultaneously, or more accurately, serially, since there seemed to be only one waiter, and the owner who decided to chip in, tending to the entire room and they could only carry two hot plates at a time.

And it wasn't worth the wait.  The starch and veggies were, again, of institutional quality, like something that would be served at an old folk's home: overly steamed, wilted, bland, bad.  My scallops were just OK.  My partner's fish in parchment was totally unexciting.  Again -- BLAND.

I became annoyed and lost all interest in the meal.  We collected our check, left a minimum tip and departed, vowing to never return.

Forewarned is forearmed!  Diner beware.  This place is highly over-rated.

P.S. - SUPER hard to find parking around there (Nob Hill).  Allow 30-45 minutes to accomplish parking.
author: Presley A.

description: The food is pretty decent, we had oysters, clam chowder and cioppino. The service is really long tho... don't go there if you are the impatient kind of person... it took us 45min to get our appetizers...
author: Tiphaine L.

description:
Came here with a friend for happy hour (on a Saturday, god bless you). We ordered a dozen oysters, cheese plate, and a couple beers. It was early November and they had a selection of oysters (3 or 4 kinds/locations) from Washington. These were the best oysters of my life! I know...they aren't local but they were huge and flavorful. The cheese plate was a bit sad so less 1 star. I will definitely be back however!

Also the cable car runs right past here and the white linen table clothes make this an ideal date spot. The decor is perfect for an old seafood house IMO.
author: Aubrey O.

description: Cozy little spot with friendly service - come here for their Oysters HH special from 5-7pm- Outstanding bargain! A dozen for $14.
author: Veronica S.

description: This was one of the worst and over priced meals I've had in SF. They called the dish scallops and prawns; by which they took 16/20 shrimp and cut 2 scallops in half and served 3 halfs in a dish obviously stuck under a broiler until the shrimp was rubber and the butter broke in the tiny dish. On the side was again, 3 half potatoes and 4 pieces of overly steamed vegetables. All this for $26 ?!?! Plz do not go here and feel hungry shortly after like I did.
author: Doug S.

description:
Your friendly neighborhood oyster bar. The interior is decorated with various items that you'd associate with an old seaship. I recall some wooden steering wheels and there's a giant vintage-looking map above the bar where we sat. The bartender was really nice and offered some wine pairings with our food, which is always fun. There are always some characters that come in from the neighborhood for some bomb oysters. Ate around two dozen of those iced, raw, slimy oysters and tried some lobster bisque, which was also recommended by the bartender.

He also recommended another oyster bar out in Oakland called Luka's which I'm going to have to try in the near future.
author: Jerry Y.

description:
Hubby and I arrived for an early dinner after trekking about a mile and a half uphill from our hotel. WELL worth it. I had a glass of the house Chardonnay and it was delicious and followed it up with the halibut en Papillote which by far is the best meal I've had so far in San Francisco. I didn't eat the potatoes included in my meal. While the veggies were well-seasoned, I found the potatoes pretty bland. The lobster bisque wasn't bad either.

The restaurant is on the Powell Hyde cable car route so it would be fun to take the cable car here as well.
author: Julie B.

description: So my family wanted a good seafood restaurant to try while they were visiting.  I saw the reviews so I made a reservation for 7 people.  When I called ahead, I asked what the restaurant was known for.  I was told the lobster bisque and few other seafood dishes.  I asked if there was music and was told there was soft jazz music played.  My family Uber-ed to the restaurant.  The experience was awful. When we arrived there was no host to great us, but the very friendly bartender told us we could sit at one if two tables.  There was no music and the atmosphere of the room we were in was compared to that of a funeral home.  It felt cold and dark and none of the staff smiled or seemed happy.  I looked around the rest of the restaurant and ran into a few of the staff members working. I've never felt so un-welcomed.  I had to ask for music even though, I was told there would be some over the phone when I called.  She proceeded to explain that she had to turn on the CD player.  I would say don't share this information with patrons.  It makes you sound old school and to cheap to buy a sound system or network.  We were offered water.   When we agreed, the waitress proceeded to the sink (in the same room we were in) and filled the pitcher with tap water from the sink.  The odd thing was that the waitress filled everyone's glass, 1/4 of the way and went back to the sink 3 times to finish getting our water.  It felt cheap and is there only one water pitcher for the restaurant (bring two since you have a lot of people)?  Maybe fill up your water vessels all at one time so your guest don't see you literally holding the pitcher over the sink during their service.  No one drank the water; we order a bottle of wine instead.  Why did we have to order wine? There is no real bar there.  They have a few beers on tap, wine, but no hard liquor for cocktails. Disappointing.  Next, we ordered oyster for an appetizer.  Those were very good and everyone enjoyed that.  Two people in my party order the lobster bisque.  Both said the soup was cool and I could see that the consistency was that of watery oatmeal.  Bisque is not suppose to be curdled.  My family was trying to be polite but I wasn't about to let them eat it.  I told the waitress.  No apology or explanation was given she just took them back and offered a different soup.  She seemed so bothered. Everyone passed on a second soup.  By this point, I was completely embarrassed.  I pulled out my phone, made a reservation at another restaurant that I know had great service and great food.  When I told the waitress we were not staying for the rest of the meal, she didn't ask why or send over a manager, she said okay and gave me the check.  I paid and we left. Hmmmm... So, I guess you are okay with not knowing why I won't be back or why you lost a party of 7.  We went to the other restaurant, where we were not afraid to drink the water, we ordered drinks, appetizers, entree's and desert and had a great time.  Life is to short for bad service and bad food especially when you pay for it.
author: J M.

description:
Was in the area and this place happened to be open for dinner on Labor Day with seats available, hurray!

Food was quite good -- my sea bass en papillote was light but tasty (though I think I might prefer a lil more seasoning somehow), which went well with boyf's cioppino. My other friend got a tasty salmon (but he preferred my sea bass.. which was the last one of the night).

I really enjoyed the sourdough bread too, but unfortunately they were so freakishly understaffed/overwhelmed that we struggled to get glasses of water, barely got our checks, and never got more bread. They were nice though!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Fish was OK. Wine was tasty though.

The best thing about this restaurant that makes it worth it is the oyster happy hour.
author: Kyle S.

description: Incredibly Slow service. In fact, I am writing this review while waiting for the bill. The staff is really nice and the food is good. Its not mind blowing and I was expecting more based on the yelp reviews. Dessert was the best part.
author: Rupa P.

description: Steamed mussel appetizer was good but entries were bland. I had the snapper in parchment no seasoning at all potatoes were not cooked enough. My wife had stuffed trout the stuffing was good bit fish was not seasoned. Overall very underwhelming.
author: Shayne L.

description:
Great and really fresh seafood. The garlic prawns are amazing!!

The servers are really nice and helpful. I have a gluten allergy and they were very accommodating and helpful in letting me know what I can order.

I will definitely be back!
author: Jeffrey K.

description:
The greatest sin is over-cooked lobster and classic seafood done wrong. I've tried terribly to like this place, but:

* oysters are sub-par
* lobster ravioli was bleh
* lobster bisque just ok
* lobster was over-cooked on the 2 occasions I sprung for the $50 disappointment. When that claw meat shreds like can canned tuna it's enough to make you cry.

The Kumamoto's we're the only decent and consistent thing here... But at $38/dozen I'll just stick to Swan Depot.
author: Grayson K.

description: The most awful service and food ever. I am totally addicted to seafood so I decided to try this place last night. We ordered the whole crab for $48 and it's suppose to weigh 1.5lbs. To our surprise it was so small and we asked the wait staff for another and they rejected U.S. I feel so rip off! It was not worth $48. Not even $20!
author: Laura C.

description: A lovely place for my 27th birthday.  A cozy atmosphere with family. The owners were very sweet and the foods were delicious.
author: Michael Q.

description:
We ate here earlier this week. 

The Good:
We called ahead to make sure that there was no wait, and there wasn't. When we walked in we were greeted immediately and the menu selection was nice. The food was great! He got the fettuccine and it was absolutely delicious. I finished it for him! I ordered the cajun scallops and shrimp. While I wish there was more of it, it was amazing. It came with veggies and ranch, which some may find unsophisticated, but I am from Texas and I was not complaining. 

The Not So Good:
I had a margarita with no salt. It was mediocre. It kind of tasted like it was a pre-mixed margarita. The bread was not very fresh and it came with butter that tasted like refrigerator. Everyone knows that refrigerator taste....like it has been sitting in the fridge  with no cover....pretty gross. I did not eat any of the bread and butter. 

The service was fast and the ambiance was nice. We would go back because the entrees were so pleasing.
author: Jazmyn W.

description: Great deal on oysters but not that good in terms of flavor. A fun place for happy hour. Sort of odd seating setup doesn't feel super welcoming when you first walk in.
author: Carly K.

description:
One of the two perfect meals I had in CA was at the Hyde Street Seafood and Raw Bar. Here's why:
- not touristy whatsoever
- completely comfortable in being neighborhood-y, not trendy
- wood paneled, nautical themed decor that feels quaint and timeless
- the ambient noise and music levels were perfect. They played full albums of Nat King Cole and Patsy Cline while we were there.
- in a nice neighborhood
- we came at happy hour and got great oysters for cheap: a dozen for $14!
- everything on the menu looked reasonably priced and delicious
- our food actually was delicious. The fish en papillotte is served in parchment paper where it is steamed to tender perfection along with tons if vegetables
- the waiter was warm, attentive but not overbearing, and knowledgeable about the menu

I would love to come back one day.
author: Becca R.

description: Love the lobster ravioli pasta ! Amazing. Well priced great seafood dishes and an adorable ambience
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Ocassion: I had dinner here on a Tuesday night for a friend's birthday.

First of all, it was really hard to find parking (took about 20 minutes).

We made an 8pm reservation and had the whole right section of the restaurant to ourselves (definitely good for big parties).  The workers were extremely friendly and interactive.  Aside from that, I absolutely loved the ambiance (dim lighting and cute sea theme decor).

Note: I will rate each dish out of 5 stars.

The lobster bisque had a good amount of creaminess and flavor, but it could have been better if there were more lobster pieces in it.  3 stars

Crab cakes are my ultimate must-order dish at restaurants, so knowing that this was a seafood restaurant, I was highly disappointed on the consistency and quality of it.  The outside of it was not crispy enough and the inside was too mushy/mashed together.  1 star

The canjun calamari was too bland. 2 stars

It was my first time trying raw clams and it became my new love.  It tasted fresh and paired well with the cocktail sauces.  4 stars

The watered down cioppinno lacked tomato flavor.  It was not the typical sizzling hot ciopinno served in a pot.  1 star
  
The salmon with capers was the best dish that night.  It flaked off easily, an indication of a moist, silky texture and it was.  The creamy sweetness of the white sauce along with the salted capers drizzled on top of the salmon was mMm mMm GOOD! 4 stars

The stuffed prawns came in four pieces.  The stuffing had similar texture as the crab cakes.  I'd prefer it to be in chunkier pieces.  3 stars

Although the food did not live up to my full expectations, I will give it another try, specifically for the $1 oysters during happy hour.
author: Therese F.

description:
OYSTER HAPPY HOUR!!

$14 for 12 from 5-7pm every day. They have about four different kinds you can get, so just ask which type is the biggest one. My boyfriend and I sampled each one and the bigger one was our favorite! And it was SO GOOD that we ordered another platter. Get extra lemons.  Mmmm mmm good. 

I also tried their escargot ($10) there. For a first try, I thought it was pretty good.. hot, buttery, and just the right amount of garlic. 

Since we were stuffed with oysters and complimentary bread, that's all we ordered. Our waiter was extremely friendly, helpful, and patient with us. 

Overall, great happy hour and service, perfect place to have a romantic date with your loved one. You can make a reservation via Yelp in case it gets busy. 

Parking sucks though. It took forever to find a spot, so good luck.
author: Vittoria L.

description: They do not have a full bar! Didn't tell us the happy hour special for oysters. food was so so.
author: Sarah H.

description: Lovely happy hour, charming joint. I liked the staff lots and the complimentary bread is heaven..would Noor come again? Yes siree!
author: Noor A.

description: Love the atmosphere.  Took wife there and wife was thoroughly impressed with setting, service, and of course the food.  Lobster bisque is to die for.  I recommend the scallop and halibut dish.  Price of food is very good for this quality.  Highly recommended and will definitely come back every time when visiting SF.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Came here with friends who were coming in from out of the country and wanted seafood.  This place was suggested by a friend of ours who lives in SF.

Made reservations for 7pm on a Saturday.  We came in at 6:40 and were promptly seated.  FIrst thing I notice is the cool, rustic maritime decor.  Cool, reminds me of New England and makes me homesick.

We ordered stuffed mushroom appetizer, escargot appetizer, our friends ordered a dungeness crab for their dinner, my husband ordered the stuffed trout and I ordered the garlic baked prawns. 4 beers.

Here's the rundown on the meal:

 
*Escargot was DELICIOUS!! buttery, garlicky, tender divine, melt in your mouth.
*Stuffed mushrooms - meh. I've definitely had better.  4 small mushrooms on a tiny bed of greens.
*Dungeness crab - HUGE.  Being Brazilian, our friends had never had dungeness before, they loved it.
*Stuffed trout.  Husband gave us all a taste. O.M.G. delicious!  I should have ordered that.
*Garlic baked prawns - No.   I love garlic baked anything.  Why do I say No?  Because I got 5.  Yes, 5 prawns.  They were not jumbo either, and were slightly overcooked.

All of our entrees came with  delicious mix of vegetables (baby potatoes, cauliflower, carrots and green beans) on a garlic sour cream that was so good.  My only suggestion to them if that they give more vegetables!  

I give it 4 stars because although service was slightly slow, it was SF on a Saturday, and although I was not crazy about my meal, I tried a bit of everyone else's and it was delicious.  Next time we go back, I will definitely order the stuffed trout.

We split the check and it was only $80 per couple with tip.  Not bad for seafood in SF.
author: Lisa F.

description:
Wife and I were lured into this place because of the happy hour deals on oysters and beer. 

We hopped the Hyde and Beach cable car which stops right in front of this cozy establishment on Russian Hill.

We were the only patrons there. Service was great as a result. 

We started off with a dozen oysters for $14. Local, British Columbia, and DC oysters joined the platter.

We ordered the lobster bisque, caesar salad, and seafood fettuccine. 

As it turned out the star of the show was the lobster bisque.

All the other lobster bisques I've had have been a red/orange sauce. This was white like clam chowder.

There were literally chunks of lobster in every bite...like there was more lobster than creme. 

I had the 3.50 happy hour beer, wife had a pinot grigio which was off the happy hour menu.

Dinner for two=100isch tip included. 

We should have walked back to Union Square we were so full.
author: Michael M.

description: Happy hour is the bomb! My wife and I ate our hearts out with oysters and clams and drank a few Stellas to wash them down. Nice little place. Get there early of you want a seat at their bar with limited space!
author: Mike G.

description:
This quaint little seafood restaurant is hidden among a tree-lined street in Nob Hill.

My cousin and I popped in last night and immediately grabbed seats at the bar next to the space heater - brr! We noticed the Happy Hour sign outside: $2.50 draft beers, $6 select cocktails and $12 for a dozen oysters (they offer three kinds and you can mix and match). 

Seeing as we had already eaten dinner, we opted for some draft beers and the lobster bisque, at our bartender's suggestion. The soup was amazing! So creamy. And you could taste the little bits of fresh lobster throughout. I used the sourdough bread to sop up what was left at the bottom of the bowl. Mmm!

If the bisque was any indication of what the food is like, then this is an amazing place. 

Bartenders were really cool. Bathroom is clean and spacious. Free 2-hour parking all around. I've got this place bookmarked and I WILL be back for dinner. Soon.
author: Mariela D.

description:
A delightful restaurant!!
