Rustic ambience, welcoming staff and romantic lighting. The highlight was the simple but sensational cioppino with fettuccine.

A truly authentic San Francisco eatery.
author: Ed F.

description:
(Maybe I should lie so I'll get to keep this place all to myself...)

Yeah, they are this fantastic.  Oyster happy hour is awesome! $15/dz until 7pm, I believe.  Lobster bisque, yum yum :D.  Perfect with the fluffy, doughy bread...drool...

Ordered the special, which was a meaty white fish cooked French Provincial style in parchment paper... triple yum!  Writing this review makes me want to go there right now for dinner.

Only thing though is parking is difficult in that area, but that's to be expected.  My recommendation: get there around 5 or 6 and parking should be OK (then go to Swensen's for ice cream dessert) or park near Ghirardelli, hop on the cable car, have oysters then go back to Ghirardelli for hot fudge sundaes afterwards!
author: Alice L.

description:
Yelped this place while in San Francisco and came here during the Winter time. Damn being in socal all my life, SF winters are freezing to me -_-

Anyhow, overall this place is good though some of the tables are a little squished even though the place overall is big enough to accommodate bigger tables. But it's definitely nice to sit by a window and enjoy the view outside. It'd be so cute if it snowed and you gaze outside the window watching the snow! 

Food time! 
Lobster Bisque- 5/5. If a restaurant serves lobster bisque, then I'm bound to get it, it's one of my all time favorite dishes and to this day, THIS IS THE BEST I've ever had. It was so creamy and delicious. I think often times it's the seasoning that ruins the bisque at certain establishments, but it's seasoned to perfection here with chunks of lobster.

Half dozen local ray oysters- 4/5. Nothing much to say, pretty fresh though not huge. But good.

Escargots- 4/5. Deliciousss. My friend tried it for the first time and she loved it also. Not the best I've had, but the best I've had was somewhere in Paris so I guess that's not a fair comparison -_- haha 

Cioppino pasta- 4/5. lotsssss of seafood in this pasta, must try for all seafood lovers. I'm not too big on seafood, but my friend loved it and she loves seafood. It's pretty heavy on the seafood meat so you'll def get really full from this dish. The sauce was light enough not to overpower the seafood at all, which is good in any seafood dish.

Cajun combo Prawns & Scallops- 4/5. Has quite a bit of flavor and it was really nice. Recommend for the stronger palette. 

Good experience overall, although I feel like inside could do with a little renovations. Plus the layout is really weird they seem to have sections of the restaurant here and there, it'll be better to have a big room. It'll seem much bigger and grander.

BUT it isn't very touristy with is really good!
author: Amy C.

description: If you are craving seafood, this is the place to go.  Ambiance is like an old fisherman's boat, which is consistent with the fresh tasting seafood dishes.  Definitely would recommend.  Doesn't hurt that the bartender is cute too.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Fail.  

I chose this restaurant for a party of 6 -- my parents were visiting and I wanted them to meet my boyfriend's brother and girlfriend.  A triple date, if you will.

My parents wanted seafood, and since my first choice of Sotto Mare could have been a ridiculous wait I went back to the drawing board.  I liked the ambiance of the restaurant location right of the trolley tracks...but that is where my affinity for Hyde Street Seafood ends.

First of all, they sat us in the bar side of the restaurant which smelled kinda funky.  the bartender was our "server" which made service slow, disjointed and not very enjoyable (he was nice, though).

The appetizers were a rip off -- $16 for a dish of two very small crab cakes.  We ordered three apps and all were just pretty sad looking.

We all ordered seafood, and we found all of the dishes to be satisfactory but nothing more.  At $20+ a plate and with as many options as there is for seafood in SF, I am shocked that this place is still in business.  While I would go back there if I had to -- I don't intend to return.
author: Tami S.

description:
This restaurant is the equivalent of a slow slow car crash.  Emphasis on 'slow.'

We had reservations on New Year's Eve for 8:30 p.m.  Our entire party showed up at 8:20 p.m.  We weren't seated until 9:45 p.m.  We didn't get our food until 10:30 p.m.  

We stood and waited forever.  No emphasis on 'forever.'  

We let them know that we were there, were ignored mostly, got to watch a bunch of quintessential idiot hipsters breeze right in with open containers and sit right down even when our reservations were at the SAME time as theirs, and continued to wait some more.  The hostess was rambling about strange things, telling us that we should have called to confirm that we were actually coming, .... what?  No, lady, YOU should have called us to confirm.  We were finally seated in the back of the restaurant, where we continued to wait for water, extra place settings, any sign of life.  I can understand being under-staffed, but they were NOT busy enough for us to feel sorry for them.   We contemplated walking out about 10 times, but a few in the group insisted on seeing this shit show through to the end.  Dumb idea.

My friend was on the phone at the table getting ready to order a pizza when they finally showed up to take our food orders.  We had oysters (which were great), and each had a fish dish.  The food did NOT make up for the horrendous wait and experience thus far.  The preparation of the dishes looked straight out of the 70s (not in a good way).  

In all, we dropped close to $500 dollars, and really wished we had ordered the pizza instead.  Bad start to any fun night.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
For the first time, We had oysters and Sea bass during Happy Hour. Very fresh and scrumptious! Also had a friendly service. 
But the second visit, we waited total of45 min to get our meal. Disappointed. Still seafood was fresh.
author: Akiko M.

description:
Perfect little romantic seafood place in the heart of Russian Hill. Great fish, intimate ambiance and it's relatively quiet. 
Can't wait to go back and have some Sea Bass, it was cooked to perfection. Oh, and their bread is so good nice and warm with plenty of soft butter to go around. Who doesn't like soaking up that juice with your bread from the fish....mmmm,mmm,mmm.
author: Brad G.

description:
So I came here with my sister for happy hour.  The restaurant was so cute inside, somewhere you could go for a casual lunch or a nice dinner.  Service was great.  Servers were very friendly and attentive.  Ordered the dozen oysters for $14.  They didnt seem as fresh as other places serve them.  I also enjoy the brininess in oysters, like tomales bay oysters, but the taste of the fanny bay and anchor? oysters here were a little too subtle for my taste. But for those that like a milder taste check this place out!

The lobster bisque I thought was okay, didnt really stand out to me much tho.
author: Christine N.

description:
I went with my parents from out of town. The overall experience was excellent and all the food was good.

I started with a margarita, but it was made with sojou which has only 20% alcohol, but regardless was one of the best I've ever had. Very fresh.

I had clam chowder and lobster ravioli with shrimp and scallops in a cream sauce. Both were hot, fresh and tasty.

My dad had lobster bisque and a piece of grilled fish and my mom had oysters, all of which were excellent.
author: Jordan C.

description: A very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere. The clam chowder was quite good, but we had a very light meal so I cannot recommend any other food here.  That said, there is a nice happy hour oyster special for 1/2 price that I'd definitely come back to check out another time.
author: Hannah A.

description:
How on earth does this place get 4/5 stars from people?  Do they have a different chef everyday? I'm boggled when a place gets such varied reviews.

For us, the food really made the place unbearable.

FOOD:
------------------------
We ordered:
-Happy Hour Oysters
-Shitaake mushrooms
-Cioppino
-Glass of wine.

Oysters were ok, definitely had better.  Some on mine weren't completely clean and had sand or something in it.

Mushrooms were slightly burnt and overcooked.

Cioppino---blech.  All the fish/scallop/shrimp were overcooked and rubbery. Stew was bland and tasteless.

SERVICE
------------------------
Great... at first.  The waiter was very attentive and answered all our questions.  But we got there early and the restaurant was only 1/4 full.  As dinner went on, we were totally forgotten.  We shared our food, but we had to ask for separate clean plates which took a while to get.  Also when we asked for check no one asked us for dessert--even though several tables around us were asked.  Food was also SUPER SLOW to get!!  I think we waited almost an hour before we finally got served....

For the price, we can find better... this is place is overrated.  Funny thing is, everyone around us kept saying food was great and "absolutely wonderful".  Maybe I don't know my seafood very well , but it's hard to ignore rubbery food...
author: Nolan Z.

description:
A great neighborhood spot.

This spot is a gem. Cozy, great food, attentive service and old-school decor. This isn't the place to go for the latest trendy microgreens or artisinal cocktails. It IS the place to go for straightforward, extremely fresh, expertly-prepared seafood and very decent wines. Reasonable prices too.

I will be going there monthly, if not more often.
author: Stu M.

description:
Very nice.  Small and quaint.  Menu covers all the bases and everything was very tasty.  Service started out excellent but started to decline when it got busier, however everyone was very pleasant and knowledgable.  Overall, very good portions.

What we had:
-Oysters (the happy hour is great and lots of options.... Very fresh)
-The lobster bisque.... Done. Little differently and very good... It is almost like puréed lobster... Less heavy cream and brandy. 
- the crab and prawn cocktail... Very fresh... A bit small, though.
- the lobster ravioli special... Very yummy with a lot of crab, shrimp, and scallops. Very light cream sauce.
- the crab "potpie".  This isn't the name on the menu but I'm blanking on the name.  This was delicious...fresh...the pastry shell was so light and buttery, crab was deliciously fresh and tender, and fresh vegetables on the side.
- the seafood combo special.  The escalbar fish, crab, and scallops were all so fresh and deviously prepared.  
- creme brûlée... Basic but constant... Don't well
- chocolate cheesecake... Really light but rich in flavor.  Gram cracker crust with a chocolate layer and a little plain cheesecake layer.. Fresh strawberries and whip-cream on the side.

Tips:  
-There is no valet and parking is a nightmare in this neighborhood. 
-They only serve beer and wine... Just an FYI.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
$1 Oyster Happy Hour from 5-7pm every single day? EXCELLENT!

It's so great to find a $1 oyster happy hour on the weekends, especially in a free parking area like Nob Hill. It's only open for dinner from 5pm and on so don't bother coming here for lunch. It's a family-owned joint and the service is very friendly and personable. 

The food details: 
Technically, it's $12 for a dozen oysters (so no you can't actually order one oyster for $1) but that's good enough right? There's three types that go on during happy hour:
1. Diamond point (east coast)- The first one I had was pretty good; creamy and the biggest sized. However, the rest of these ended up tasting very subtle. Not bad but weird that there wasn't a huge taste to it
2. Marin bay (local)- salty and grainy. Probably my least favorite but not horrible
3. Fanny bay (bc)- Mid-size oysters that are definitely meaty to say the least. 
We also tried the Lobster Bisque since there were so many raves about it. It's pretty good. Creamy with bits of chunks in it. I've never really had lobster bisque so I don't really have anything to compare it to but I guess it was okay.
Beers during happy hour go for $2.50 each. 

Overall, I like the place. The oysters aren't anything amazing but it's still $1 oyster so how can you really go wrong right? It's definitely worth a visit if you're really craving oysters but don't want to chock up full-price at other places. But like I said, the oysters are probably good only due to quantity, not quality.
author: Diana Y.

description:
This is pretty much a neighborhood spot to take older relatives without a refined palate (or none at all) who don't want to venture out of the neighborhood. The food was exceedingly average, and for the price I kicked myself the entire time for not going to Sotto Mare and getting my money's worth.

Service was good though, and you can get points for reserving through OpenTable.
author: Ting S.

description:
The law of averages results in a 3... my math teacher always wanted me to show my work so he re it is...

Lobster Bisque: 5 stars
Wow. Seriously, I could have should have eaten a vat of this. If you go and do not order this I will take it as a personal attack on my tastebuds. 

Draft beer prices/choices: 4 stars
Something local, something foreign and only $3.50 each during a longer than expected happy hour :-)

Ahi Tuna: 3 stars
I love Ahi Tuna. My friend ordered it and shared some with me. It was cooked perfectly but the seasoning is what knocks down the stars for me. While great tuna could stand on its own, this one tried to survive on the peppercorn crust which was pretty standard. For the price I expected more creativity. I'm a snobby Ahi eater :-)

Potatoes: 4 stars
This girl likes her starch and the side of potatoes were perfect inside and out... think of fancy potato wedges.

Swordfish: 1 star
Oh my disappointment, seriously! I LOVE swordfish because it tends to be thick, steak like texture filled with flavor.  Have you ever made the mistake of buying a Gordon's Fisherman box of frozen fish from the grocery store? I mean it was on sale so you tried it despite your better judgement? Yeah it was like that... thin (wha?!) flavorless and drowned in a buttery sauce to hide the truth. Lame piece of fishy.

Would I go back? Definitely just for the Lobster Bisque and happy hour special... but next time I would take the cable car and save my butt the extra workout... I'd also try some other fish dishes... maybe it was just a lackluster Day's Catch?

Also service is S L O W.... so be uber patient. I think they might be short staffed.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Ho hum.

This is one of those places where the Yelp reviews are skewed by a bunch of people who don't live in San Francisco. 

As I've pretty much reviewed every lobster related thing in San Francisco, I picked Hyde Street Seafood for my birthday dinner with friends. It sounded like a winner. Casual, somewhat salty decor and solid seafood. The decor lived up to the expectation by the seafood was pretty unexceptional.

The lobster bisque is not good. There are little mealy chunks of overcooked lobster and it was sort of watery. Pretty disappointing given that  most people were raving about it like it was the new black.

Strangely enough, the real winner of this dinner was the creme brulee. Who woulda thunk?
author: Eli B.

description:
What a find!!
In town for only a few days and stumbled in to Hyde Street Seafood House while walking back to our hotel.  Cozy neighborhood dining spot atmosphere and Happy Hour specials caught our attention.  Half dozen west coast oysters for $14 were delicious.  Tables are close and made for wonderful conversation as we met the couples sitting near us.  Owner/servers were friendly and very helpful.  Ordered sea bass encroute and stuffed oysters as well.  Everything was fresh, cooked well and delicious yet moderately priced, made for a delightful and memorable dining experience.
author: Beth B.

description:
Upon arrival for our 6:30 reso, I was very disappointed with my first impression of the place.  The sign out front says they've been open since 1985 and it is quite evident in the decor. It appears to not have had any renovations or redecorating since then.  I reminded myself that I'm going to a restaurant to enjoy the food, first and foremost so I tried to keep an open mind.

We waited at the front of the restaurant for a few minutes, and no one greeted us.  I know, a few minutes doesn't seem like a lot of time, but the restaurant was pretty empty, so it was a bit awkward to wait there for what seemed like an eternity as the two parties that were there just kept looking at us.  Not a good sign for a Saturday night in SF's bustling restaurant scene.

Finally, the waiter came by and I guess he was doing double duty as the host.  He was very nice and sat us at our table.  We ordered a prosecco and a kir and unfortunately, they were both flat with barely any bubbles.  We informed the other server, and she apologized and provided us with new drinks that were from a new bottle and this time, they were full of bubbles!

The menu is quite overwhelming with about 20 cold and hot appetizers and 15 entrees.  For such a small seafood restaurant, I was a little concerned that they had so many options.  How is it possible to have so many items with fresh ingredients and execute the dishes flawlessly?  We ordered the crab cocktail and the calamari salad.  Both were okay but rather forgettable.  For our entrees, we had the sea bass en papillote and the stuffed prawns with bernaise sauce.  The sea bass was extremely disappointing with barely any flavor and it was just served on top of a bed of shredded vegetables a' la 1970 and plain potatoes.  I ate most of the fish because it was $26 and left everything else.  The stuffed prawns were okay but the presentation and flavors were nothing special.

Despite the nice servers and charming Russian Hill location with views of the cable cars going by, the restaurant was a huge disappointment and I will not be returning.  There are just way too many other SF restaurants in the same price range that are superior to Hyde Street Seafood House.
author: Frank G.

description:
This place was a bit dead when I came 30 minutes after opening. It wasn't actually even clear that it was open. I may have been the only diner to begin with but it slowly filled up. The atmosphere left something to be desired.

The oysters were a good deal, but the fish was a bit disappointing. I had the parchment baked salmon. It was undercooked in the middle. The julienned vegetables were okay but not very tasty.
author: Victor W.

description:
I came here for my birthday,the food and service was excellent!!!  
The entree I had and recommend was the grilled swordfish.  They accommodated me by making it gluten free upon request!!
The oysters were good and yes they are smaller as they are from the Atlantic.
I have told others about this place and I will be back!!
author: gayle w.

description: The service was fabulous!!! The seafood was delightful, ambiance is great! The staff Made my friends birthday special! Wanted to give 4.5 stars only because the sides could be much improved! Everything else is great!
author: Beth N.

description:
Love love love the fish en papillote. Cute place, typically crowded but getting in isn't too hard. 

I haven't tried the other dishes, but would happily do so given my contentment with the above mentioned dish. They have a decent wine/beer/cocktail selection, so depending on the mood your'e in / evening ahead, Hyde Street has something for you!
author: Brianna M.

description:
We came here after a long day at the Exploratorium just in time for the oyster happy hour. It is $12 for a half dozen of assorted oysters from different areas and $15 for a half dozen of the kumamoto Hog Island oysters. The kumamotos were awesome (as expected), but the other oysters were also great to try as well. We then had the lobster bisque which was absolutely delicious (the first time I've tried lobster bisque!). It was like a grown up version of clam chowder. For my entree, I had their pasta special, fettuccine with scallops, salmon, and shrimp ($18). The entree was good and not too creamy. I also had a bite of my cousin's halibut poached in parchment paper (~$20). The halibut practically melts in your mouth.  

The atmosphere was pretty low key. There are two different dining rooms. If I had to choose again I would choose the dining room to the left since it isn't in the way of the door. Overall, the dining room provides a rather intimate setting. The waiters were also top notch and served us quickly and with a smile. I would definitely come here again for the oyster happy hour and the lobster bisque!
author: Angela L.

description:
Signs we should have turned around and walked out:
1.) A faint rotten smell mixed with bleach.
2.) Good deal for happy hour, but no customers.

Signs we should have cut our losses, not order food and walk out:
1.) Bartender couldn't remember two orders of Spaten (as opposed to Stella) and proceeded to yell out for a reminder from waiter. At least the place looked like it should be classy, white tablecloths and all.
2.) Complimentary bread had the stale taste of being around seafood.

Signs we should not have eaten the oysters:
1.) Shells were slimy from not having been cleaned well, or from hangjng around too long.
2.) Odd slime stuck on edges of shell.
3.) Oysters had no oyster shape and were falling apart in the shell. 
4.) Oysters had no real taste or had a bad fishy taste.
5.) Upon closer inspection, they were also leaking a light yellow fluid.

At that point it occurred to me that if I were to continue eating I would probably regret it terribly.  I've never had bad oysters, so my thoughts that night were spent hoping I didn't get sick. I ended up eating six sorry excuses for oysters and my bf ate two. 

We came on the Tuesday before the 4th of July.  Perhaps they did not order many fresh oysters in anticipation of the short week/slow business.  However, that's not a good enough excuse to serve foul seafood.

Note to self: Hone foodie instincts and follow them the next time, especially when there are warning signs about eating seafood!
author: Erica D.

description:
This is located in a great location, right on the cable car line. 
It gets busy often so I usually make reservations. It's not a very big restaurant but never feels crowded or stuffy. 

The restaurant staff and waiters are extreme nice & accommodating! Food comes out quick.
Everything I've tried here has been absolutely delicious! They have a good selection of oysters and other raw seafood.
The wine list is small but I always find something good to drink on it.
author: Katrina M.

description:
Ok mistake number one: I ordered steak.
mistake # 2: I went in with my brother.
mistake # 3, I stumbled up on this place, so no! It wasnt planned.
Monday afternoon, craving steak. Called up my brother and we started walking up the street looking for red meat. 
Memorial weekend and not a lot of choices, we decided to try a seafood restaurant.

What I loved about this place was the Frank Sinatra songs, the older, cute couples sitting at different tables and the "watch your step signs" all over the restaurant. 

The clam Chowder soup was YUMMY! the snapper "my brother's choice" was good! Their Banana bread pudding was delicious!!! and the steak was a "straight up, sorry!! " yes a disaster.
author: Kajal P.

description:
So me and my bf both love oysters and we love to go on oyster adventures searching for the most awesome oyster ever.  We've had the good and we've had the bad!  But this oyster experience was excellent!  Our waiter was also very attentive and sweet.  My bf and I both enjoyed the wines that we ordered.  I had the Gewürztraminer and he had the white Riesling (they were both pretty sweet and tasty).  We then proceeded to try the snail (Escargot if you're fancy).  I was a little weary of trying the thing that I avoid like the plague when walking on a wet sidewalk but I figured I'd try it..just once.  The snail was based in butter and garlic and the texture was that of a mussel.  It was pretty darn good and I would definitely recommend it when you go.  I ended the date with the ciopinno which was good (the best ciopinno I've had was actually at Luna Park).  My bf said his pork chop tasted like fish.  So I suggest you stick to the seafood if you go!  

All in all, I had a great experience here and I would def come back for the oysters!!!  YUM!!
author: Crystal C.

description: Come here for the sweet, succulent $1 oysters during happy hour (every day 5-7), and the potato crusted king salmon with pinot noir sauce.  The potatoes were slightly crisp and the salmon was unbelievably moist and delicious.  The fresh crab meat was perfect with the horseradish/cocktail sauce.  Another SF gem.
author: Carol S.

description: I got their cioppino. It had pretty good flavor and they definitely didn't skimp on the seafood. The lobster was a little tough though and the person I was with had undercooked shrimp (They got ill shortly after, but it's possible it was something else). When I called to let the restaurant know, the lady was very apologetic and offered to refund us, so they handled everything gracefully.
author: Erin L.

description:
Very solid fish dishes, great vegetable mix and their fish in parchment was superb.

Service a little slow though.
author: Steve F.

description:
A very disappointing meal at a very cute restaurant. And I thought you couldn't go wrong with twinkly lights...

I was very surprised that at 7:45 on a Friday night, I was able to make an 8:30 reservation. The bf and I came in for dinner and the restaurant was less than half full. We sat down and were brought fairly stale sourdough (I think...I couldn't even tell) bread. We started with the spicy prawn appetizer, then he got seabass in parchment and I got a seafood combo special. The appetizer was ok; I think the spice came from curry powder which I didn't love. My meal was unexciting as well. I had one scallop (eh), two prawns (good) and a piece of whitefish the waiter compared to butterfish (eh). The best part was the side of creamy/cheesy potatoes. The bf wasn't too impressed by his dish, although the presentation of the papillote dishes is nice. 

The fish is delivered at 2pm ever day I heard the waiter tell another table, so I'm sure it's fresh but it just wasn't very good. If I liked oysters, I'd come back for happy hour but otherwise it was unremarkable.
author: Emilia S.

description: I was truly shocked by this place, and in a good way! Really nice, quiet, and cozy spot for high quality seafood. I had the clam chowder (which was a tad expensive, but very tasty) and my friends had French onion soup (which was exquisite) for appetizers. Then I had the king salmon en papillote, which was super fresh, tender, and healthy! The food comes in pretty large portions, which I also appreciated. I also had key lime pie for dessert (just $5), and it was cutely decorated and not too tart (the slice was a little smaller than what I was expecting, but it was still very enjoyable). I also found out that they have some great happy hour specials, which I'll take advantage of the next time I visit. The lighting was perfection, and cable cars drove by every now and then. The service couldn't have been more perfect, and they called me immediately when they realized my friend accidentally left her credit card! I will for sure be back.
author: Uche I.

description: My friend and I trekked all over looking for seafood and after a failed oyster bar mission, decided upon this establishment. What a treat. They seated us in the more formal dining area, but decided to sit in a quieter bar booth. We split a seafood salad (for 2) with super fresh crab, shrimp, and smoked salmon with a delicious light lemony dressing. Then a seafood sampler platter. I love oysters, but had never tried raw littleneck clams. Sweet and Briney, new favorite. Lobster bisque and fresh sourdough bread and an ANCHOR steam or two. The service gracious and friendly, we left satiated and pleased.
author: J L.

description:
I've been here a few times over the years and this place has stood out in my mind as a solid 4 star restaurant so I was surprised to log on here a week ago and see it listed as a 3.5. Having eaten here earlier this week I agree that the quality has gone down and I think it's closer to a 3 now.

The food was hit or miss. The escargot was good (hard to mess that up with so much butter) and the oysters were fresh. However the "prawn" "cocktail" really disappointed - instead of coming in a traditional cocktail bowl we were served 4 shrimp on a regular white plate surrounding a dollop of cocktail sauce. They were rubbery and mostly tasteless and definitely looked more like shrimp than prawns. Also, the bread was stale. Why?

I got one of the daily specials which was mahi mahi en papillote and the fish was way overcooked. This was really disappointing because mahi mahi is usually such a nice fish. 

The service otherwise was good as was the bottle of wine.
author: Alex V.

description:
Happy hour Oysterssssssssss! dozen oysters for $14, not bad!
We came here on a friday night and was seated promptly. The service was excellent. The waitstaff was attentive and was very accommodating with our indecisiveness. However, the food came out a little slow....like 30 mins slow
I was so hungry i ate a ton of bread, but hey their sourdough bread with butter was so bomb!

Petit lobster tail with garlic butter: it's some tiny lobster tail! It was good, but not great.
Seafood combo with butterfish: came with one scallop, 2 prawns and a fillet of butterfish with scalloped potatoes and some veggies. I thought the butterfish was wonderful! 

Overall, happy with the establishment. Will return for more oysters!!!
author: Emily T.

description:
If you're here for happy hour (which I think is everyday from 5-7pm), make sure you get their oysters. Its $12 per dozen, and totally worth it. The oyster specials for that day were Fanny Bays, Quilcenes, and Marin Bays. My favorites were the Quilcenes and Marin Bays, so I recommend those if your specials are the same.

I also tried their shellfish cooked en papillote style (in parchment paper with lemon butter). It was yummy; the seafood was fresh and I especially loved the scallops.
author: Elisa C.

description:
Wanted some san francisco seafood really bad. i read the reviews and thought we should try this place. Boy was I disappointed. The food was ok, we ordered a lobster which had barely any meat in it. it was around $48.00. We ordered some clams which were really good and we also ordered the escargot which was pretty good also. I guess the most disappointing thing was the lobster and the service. 

They made us wait over an hour and 15 minutes to get our food. Our party had to go to work so he didn't end up getting to eat his food and then we had to go and catch a cab so he could get to work on time. We made reservations also and got there early enough to have dinner and not be rushed. Needless to say I will be trying some where else next time to have Seafood. Big disappointment.
author: Kelly Y.

description: Wow, really good seafood here. We came during happy hour, got two dozen oysters, split their signature fish entree and desert. Loved the oysters! They give you 3 kinds, all very nice and substantial. The fish was very nicely done too. Coming from Seattle it's nice to find some really good cooked fish in San Francisco.
author: Olga A.

description:
Why on earth haven't I visited this place sooner? Three blocks from my house and such a gem.
It's a Monday night. We're in the mood for seafood. I check yelp and like what I see. I've walked by before and know it's supposed to be good. 
The food was awesome. Had the seafood sampler with Escolar, shrimp and scallops. Delicious!!! 
Johnny our server is awesome. But then he's a San Francisco native so of course he is. 
Highly recommend. We had visitors from out of town sitting on either side of us that raved about the food and service as well.
Will definitely be back.
author: Heather L.

description:
I was literally half way through writing a four star review when my dad and I came down with a pretty sever case of food poisoning.  I'm 99% sure it was from the oysters we had at Hyde Street Seafood House. 

To be fair, the oysters tasted amazing and our service was great.  My mom didn't get sick, and she only ate fully cooked (and delicious) snapper.  My butterfish was fantastic.  Honestly, I'd probably come back for oyster happy hour (in another month or so...maybe...)  

It is written on the freakin' menu that you eat raw oysters at your own risk, so I certainly feel trepidation giving a poor review--but I also think that it's fair warning.
author: Lynn M.

description: I agree and basically have the same story as one of the other reviewers.  I am from out of town and booked reservations for Valentines Day based upon the open table reviews.  The menu was a special menu, which was ok but the food was horrible.  Unlike the previous reviewer who didn't get to experience the Filet Mignon, we had the unpleasant experience.  The pizza slice would have been better.  The steak tasted like it had been cooked in a microwave and there was zero flavor.. The vegetables were just like the Steamfresh bag I buy back home at the grocery store... We said it was the most expensive TV dinner we had ever eaten...  Definitely a waste of money and time.
author: Scott S.

description:
Yummy! Lobster bisque and 3 different types of oyster ($1/oyster during happy hour)
slow service, only 3 servers working.
author: Natalia H.

description:
Stick to the super fresh briny sweet oysters. Raw clams not so much...fishy yo.

The chowder wasn't bad and I thought it was better than the Lobster Bisque..not sure what everyone is raving about.

The entrees were pretty wacked. The potato pancake tasted and had the texture of day old hashbrowns..they were dry as hell and cold. My buddy's potatoes roasted potatoes were the same. The fish was nothing to write home about..
Pretty homey presentation as well..which is fine if the grub was good.

Papillote had soy sauce and it was just on the meh side..

Escargot was bland..tasted like unsalted butter with very little garlic flavor

I like to see Chinese folks cooking food other than Chinese but it usually doesn't turn out so great and this is kind of a good example...sorry.
author: Chow L.

description: Fantastic food - very good quality fish and uncomplicated but flavorful taste. Great wine - try the Fume Blanc on the menu. And not to forget the amazing oysters!
author: Mohit A.

description:
We went for their happy hour (5-7) where they had deals for oysters and beer. 4 dollars for select beers (including anchor steam) and 14 dollars for a dozen oysters. 

The oysters were very average. Nothing wrong with them, just nothing to brag about. If you aren't picky about oysters this is a good deal. Also, there aren't crazy lines like at other oyster HH. 

The service was great. Everyone was immediyately helpful and friendly.
author: Charles S.

description:
I came here for happy hour (which is every day... even weekends! from 5-7pm) and i had been craving oysters for way too long... this place had exactly what i needed. 

Dozen oysters $14
Draft beers $3.50

YUM. wish they had wine on their happy hour menu, but considering that this place is a stone's throw from my front door, their current offering is sufficient enough. great service - they were very attentive and made sure we had plenty of oysters before happy hour was over. can't wait to go again!
author: Laura C.

description:
Very pleased with our dinner for four here. The waiter was prompted, informed and not annoying at all. The inside is intimate and upscale, yet casual and warm. 

I got a good deal on oysters.. maybe $15 I think? Husband and I had the surf and turf special and were pleased. Even though the fish was previously frozen, it was delightfully fresh and well cooked. The mushrooms on the side were AMAZING! Our friend had an entire crab and it took him quite a long time to finish it. Great, hearty portion.

Overall the price was a bit high, but the quality of the food makes up for it.
author: Kara S.

description:
We were pretty unsure about Hyde Street Seafood based on the Yelp reviews, but were pleasantly surprised. We got a strong whiff of fishy smell when we walked in and almost didn't stay because it was very unappealing. The place was also completely silent (no music), which made it kind of eerie and odd. However, our meal was very good and reasonably priced. The clam chowder and lobster bisque were both very well done (lots of meat!) and the en papillote fish was cooked to perfection and the veggies were also delicious. The staff was friendly and even made a special dish for my brother who does not like seafood. 

Bottom line: The food is tasty and is at a reasonable price point, but the restaurant would do itself good by clearing up the fishy smell and putting on some mood music.
author: Kate B.

description:
Atmosphere: 5 stars. I went there with my girlfriend and the place was as romantic as can be. Very cozy with dim lighting and cute decoration. Perfect for a date.

Food: 3 stars. I had a seafood combo and my girlfriend had the same but "en papillote" (baked in a paper pouch). They were both A-Okay, but not great.

Service: 4 stars. The staff was very friendly and attentive but a bit slow.

Prices are reasonable ($18 & $22 for our plates).

Overall, even though the food wasn't amazing and the service a little slow, I'll definitely be back for the very romantic ambiance. We left happy and frisky so I can't complain!
author: Teiki K.

description:
First time here, last time here. 
I brought my girlfriend in for Valentine's last night and had a table reserved for 9pm.
First to note, there is barely any parking around. We found a parking garage 3 blocks away which cost $20 for 2 hours. 
We get inside the restaurant and while in line we're handed a pre fixe dinner menu by an Asian lady who doesn't speak clearly. We decide on the filet mignon and lobster tail. It was a 3 course that included salad for starters and choice of dessert at the end.
We were seated 10 minutes later by the window which can only fit two people side by side. We hadn't originally planned to sit this way but after about 10 minutes began to think it was kind of nice. 
30 minutes go by and noone has taken our order. We couldn't understand why it was taking so long to be noticed when our table is seated directly next to the reservation desk and computer. The same Asian lady who handed us our menu is standing right beside us but seems to be ignoring us since she is heavily concentrated on the computer screen.  
I finally get her attention and ask if someone can come take our order and she magically becomes our server. Really? So at this restaurant, the customers need to go to the servers instead of  the other way around to be waited on. 
Anyway, our first course comes out - a crab caesar salad. It had lots of real crab that tasted fresh but lost points due to being mixed with iceberg lettuce. Then as we're eating our salad, our server tells us they are out of the filet mignon. WTF???IT'S A PRE FIXE MENU!!! 
Just as I tell the server we're going to pay for our salad and leave, she offers us both NY strips instead. I ask if there's a change in price for the inconvenience and she ignores us and walks away to tell the cook we want the NY strip. 
Then our main course comes out and this is where everything went downhill.   
Both the lobster tail and NY strip portions were very SMALL and PATHETIC. It was the most minuscule of portions I had ever seen for a dinner. So now I'm wishing we would've left after we finished our salad. 
I bite into my steak and find it's under cooked. I ordered it medium but it was raw. I tell our server/reservation assistant/whatever the hell she is that it's raw and she takes the plate and brings it back 5 minutes later. I immediately see the piece of meat I spit out originally that's now been microwaved and think to myself, how tacky. They try and make up for this by giving me some breaded shrimp but guess what?? IT'S COLD. There really isn't much to say about the lobster tail. Although it tasted good, there was no butter sauce and only took two bites to finish. It was THAT small. 
In the middle of all this there is barely any real service although the same Asian lady is standing an arm lengths away. They weren't even busy. 
We get our dessert and I get a cold pudding-like clump of what's supposed to be chocolate souffle with a cut in the middle which I guess is supposed to resemble the crack when it comes out of an oven???? My girlfriend gets a sliver of store bought key lime pie. 
Overall this dinner was over priced ($63 per person for the pre fixe) not including the bottle of wine and 1/2 dozen oysters we ordered and very disappointing. 
Then as we were ready to leave we again had to flag our server down who again was standing right next to us to ask for our check. 
Horrible service, horrible portions that make you feel like you've been ripped off. I would never come here again nor would I recommend this place.
author: Jamie A.

description:
The Oysters for happy hour I think were $14 per dozen, the Kumamoto ones are $15 for 6 pieces. If you come here just for the regular oysters then its a good value and deal. Thats pretty much the HH special...

Food wise, its just ok - my steamed seafood bag was flavorful, but the shrimp was still raw when i bit into them ( like gray on one side). Steak was horrible, they should just grill it with pepper corn and not add the wine sauce.

They did make up for the steam seafood bag  by resteaming ( or microwaving) the plate again and throwing 2 more shrimps on the side... It was a nice gesture

I am prob not coming back again.
author: B H.

description: Lovely little neighborhood spot. Great happy hour oysters...and the en papillote is so well prepared-- we had the salmon -- delicious! Unfortunately it's a bit overpriced for the amount of food and  certainly for the wine (but then again this is SF, I've come to accept that). Still recommend the place for a nice seafood dinner in the neighborhood!
author: Ada K.

description:
Delicious oysters.

Perfect fish En Papillote.

Great Lobster Bisque.

And family run customer service.

This place is great.
author: Tbone J.

description:
I usually have a wonderful meal here, but tonight I experienced something different.  Everything was great until the entrée arrived.  The scalloped potatoes were raw, as were the brussel sprouts.  Lastly, the dessert of chocolate cheese cake was the worst that I have ever experienced.

I love this restaurant, and figure they had a bad night.  They quickly replaced the raw vegetables, however it really ruined my experience.

I will go back - and I will continue to skip dessert (I gave in tonight).

Here are the good points:
awesome staff
12.00 oysters at happy hour / doz (til 7:00pm)
fresh seafood
warm and comfortable environment
great location (Hyde street cable car line)
author: Mark F.

description:
A homey (and comely) place with excellent fish en papillote and friendly, attentive service. Able to get seated immediately on a Wednesday night. 

Reasonable price for seafood, proper sit-down menu, and decent wine list.
author: Patty C.

description:
Aside from oysters, I'm a a true meat lover. I can't even remember the last time that I raved about seafood. But, maybe that's because I hadn't dined at Hyde Street Seafood House and Raw Bar yet.

#1 rave: OYSTERS - Hyde Street has $1 happy hour oysters from 5-7pm.  They pre-select 3 kinds of oysters and serve the oysters with 2 sauces: a mignonette and a cocktail sauce. I don't recall the other 2 types of oysters we had because the Fannie Bays were OUTSTANDING. The sweetness and lightness of a smaller oyster (like a blue point), but with the richness and creaminess of a larger oyster. We ordered another round of the Fannie Bays because they were so good. 

#2 rave: Seafood salad with smoked salmon, crab, and bay shrimp - We ordered the larger salad, with portions for 2 people. The amount of seafood in the salad was very generous and the freshness of the seafood was very apparent.  The salad greens were lightly dressed in a simple vinaigrette and were the perfect foundation to the sweetness of the seafood. 

#3 rave: Lobster bisque - The seafood stock used to flavor the bisque was excellent, not too briny. The sweet lobster flavor was amazing and perfectly complimented by the smooth cream base. Most bisques are too heavy or rich, but this lobster bisque was creamy, but light. 

The ambiance is dimly lit, intimate and classy. Probably not the ideal place for me to meet a gf during happy hour to catch up on gossip and get oyster-wasted. But it would be ideal for a romantic date.
author: Monelle A.

description: I was craving lobster bisque tonight and my Husband found this restaurant on Yelp. I'd been there long ago and remembered that I had a nice dinner the last time I ate there. We ordered lobster bisque, clams on the half shell, steamed muscles, garlic roasted main lobster and pan fried sole. We LOVED everything! The service was polite and very fast! It's located on the Hyde Street Cable Car line and has loads of character. We will come back again! Thank you my Husband for a wonderful evening!
author: Denny L.

description:
Oysters: ok. salmon en papillote:good. Crab cakes: mediocre. Seared Scallops w/ potatoes: SHIT.
Place had a chinese restaurant feel, not that i dont like chinese reaturants, i was just expecting something more from here..
Significant wait time: once you are there and waiting to be recognized to be seated even w/ reservations. Significant wait time: for drinks order.
Scallops not only tasted bad, presentation of the plate was lacking big time.
I wont be coming here again. I have a sick feeling in my stomach...i think it is the food i had here. Euww..
author: C A.

description:
I came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  The restaurant was pretty busy but our server, Johnny, was very attentive.  We had the lobster bisque, clam chowder and escargot to start and all were very good.  We ordered the panko crusted salmon, lobster ravioli and the cajun shrimp and scallops.  All were nicely seasoned, the salmon and shrimp & scallops were served with a side of steam veggies.  The entrees were all very standard and about $15 each.  We ended with the bread pudding which was on the house.  The bread pudding was a bit on the oily side.  I'll be back for dinner but will pass on the bread pudding nex time. 

4-stars
author: Veronica N.

description: Came for the $1 Oysters to find out they are now $2 and hella small. Great decor and everything, but that amounts to very little when you get overpriced mini oysters.
author: Chris S.

description:
There was a line up before the place even opened. That should tell you something right there. 

The wait staff were fantastically helpful with our selection and advice. My girlfriend had the Cajun shrimp and  scallop, and I had the crab. Both were fantastic and the whole meal was worth it and we would both recommend this place without hesitation.

Thank you to all for a wonderful memory...
author: North O.

description: Wonderful service the paper wrapped salmon was amazing happy hour is amazing for the price if you have the oysters their stuffed shrimp is very very good but I love the service overall
author: Patti P.

description: The only reason I give this place a 2 is because the food at least tasted good. The service was awful. These guys even tried to cheat us 2 oysters when we ordered a dozen. To which they proceeded to argue with us and even make fun of us to our face. This place needs to learn how to treat its customers better. Definitely not coming back.
author: Tom T.

description:
Went here for valentines dinner and it was horrible. lets get to the point

LOBSTER BISQUE: Cream + crab mix of some sort or frozen lobster then pureed + seasoning is not lobster bisque. 

FILET MIGNON: Flat and round, no seasoning served with boiled brocolli, baby carrot,
sauteed mushroom with no seasoning, with day old potato gratin with burnt edges and dry over sour cream. no sauce no flavor not good.

ESCARGOT: butter + garlic+ pasrley + escargot, basic and bland.

SEAFOOD COMBO: Scallops cooked to submittion, then death, lobster tail possibly the cheapest you can buy on the market which comes frozen in a plastic wrap gummy dry and flavorless about 2 oz after cooked to death. black tiger shrimp muddy flavor cooked until consistency of tennis shoes, all this stuff in butter and garlic and parsley. 

CHOCOLATE CAKE Small slice then sorrounded with canned whipped cream. 

End result: $158 check with crappy wine.
author: Riko M.

description:
Nuka oysters #1 - just give me a dozen of these bad boys please

Clam chowder w/free sourdough bread = good but not anything I would drive all the way out to SF for.

Seafood Dinner: scallops, prawns, butter fish, scalloped potatoes and vegetables = super yum! I would drive to SF for this dinner plate. 

Friendly service, nice ambience and big/clean restroom. Too bad there isn't a lot of parking in this neighborhood, but we lucked out and parked in front of the school around the corner (2 hr limit, M-F from 6-9pm).
author: Mel P.

description: Great vibe moderately priced and within walking distance of nob hill. Defintely reccommend for a nice meal.
author: Eric J.

description: This review is solely based on the oysters. My boyfriend showed me an article of the best oysters to try in SF and this one was on the list. We tried this place first as it was closest to where we were. We tried all the oysters that they offered (skookum, hammersley, fanny bay, and kumamoto. My favorite would be the kumamoto though all were pretty delicious! We came around 6pm and it was not crowded yet so we were seated right away. I loved that the waiter gave us a choice on where we wanted to sit. Our waiter was very nice as well. Will probably go back to try the other things on their menu!
author: Nancy T.

description: Great hidden gem for that special occasion or for when you just want some seafood done really well.  Must gets are the oyster especially during happy hour, seafood cioppino, garlic crab dishes, potato encrusted salmon are done extremely well.  Fast, attentive service you will truly enjoy your experience.
author: Robert L.

description:
Friendly, home style service and tasty seafood. I went for the shellfish combination in parchment paper, and it was very simple & delicious. My friend really enjoyed the lobster bisque, as well.

Decor is maybe a little old school, but I thought it was charming.
author: Kristina C.

description:
A bit underwhelmed in my experience at Hyde Street Seafood. I was excited to finally try this neighborhood spot out and despite it looking very quaint it has a really strong touristy vibe. We went at 6 pm on a saturday to get in on the oyster happy hour deal. Maybe it's better later at night? do tourists eat earlier? I don't know but that was the clientele we shared the restaurant with. OK onto the food. 

Basket of bread -weak bread. It was cold and appeared to be a day old. 
Oyster deal - dozen for $14 , great deal and tasty oysters. 
Lobster Bisque - sinfully rich with good amount of lobster chunks. 
Cioppino - OK, but nothing amazing
Snapper in their parchment specialty. Again it was OK but nothing wowing about it. 

All in all, I guess if I was nearby I'd come for oysters and bisque and then end it there. That's really all that's worth having. But, honestly, I'm lazy about walking up that hill and there are loads of other spots that serve great oysters.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
I decided to be brave and try some oysters and they were SO YUMMY.  They gave a balsalmic vinegar and a cocktail sauce and some lemons that you can put on your oysters... it was so good.  I had tried some in Puerto Rico before and they weren't that great, but these were awesome.

I was referred here by some people at one of the bars near here and they said the oysters were great... which they are.

They had a deal going that you get 12 oysters for $10.  YUM!!

I also got the seafood fettucini... very very good.  The fettucini wasn't a humongous portion too that you felt you could never finish either and it was all decently priced.

I got a cosmopolitan martini... very strong and worth the $6.

I would definitely recommend.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I came here once during happy hour. The overall experience could have been better. The oyster selection was pretty decent and tasted fresh enough. Just not the best quality overall. The lobster bisque was okay, but I was anticipating better based on some of the reviews here. 

I ordered one of the happy hour drinks, and it was pretty bad. Most of the happy hour drinks seemed to have sake in them. Whatever the case my drink had a taste similar to cough syrup.

Service was very slow. We had to wait a long time for the oysters, having our order taken, forced to flag the server down to get her attention, etc.

I love good bread with oysters/soup. The complimentary bread was pretty awful. Hard, stale, bland, and cold. 

Also, I made a reservation through yelp that apparently was not received by them. I don't know whether that is a yelp failing or them. It didn't matter as we got there right when HH started so not much of a crowd, but the seats did fill up within an hour I'd say. 

Kind of a tacky interior. I was expecting something a little more modern and sophisticated based on some pictures and descriptions. Not really a romantic place, fyi. 

Not much space between most tables. That's shitty San Fran for you though.

After writing this review I'm going from 3 stars to 2 stars. 2 stars solely for HH oysters.
author: Hunny B.

description: Our favorite neighborhood place, Hyde Street Seafood does a terrific En Papillote specialty dish and is an authentic family business in a city full of tourist traps and precious, hipster-centric designer food outlets.  Thoughtful, attentive staff, and a pleasant ambiance with nautical decor on a tree-lined street with Cable Cars.  No food reviews here (I'm not a food critic).
author: Mark J.

description: I usually don't get pissed off by a restaurant as long as the food is good. But this one is a bit too much -- food was just ordinary and nothing better than the most basic stuff I could do by myself; the waitress understood not even a single word I say neither when I told her I'm by myself nor when I asked for the bill so that I had to tell at her the word "BILL" eventually, plus she saw and then ignored me for THREE times before she finally came to me. Highly recommend travellers NOT to attend as you could totally get brilliantly tasty seafood at ferry market
author: Kayla L.

description:
Both the food and the service at this restaurant are great.  I took my mom and brother here for my mom's birthday last month. 

 I had steak, my mom had potato crusted salmon and my brother had cajun prawns.  Everyone enjoyed their dished quite a bit.  The wine was good and the beer was good.  Not happy that they charged PER soda refill.  Kind of tacky and cheap for a nicer restaurant.  

The prices were good when compared with some of the other seafood restaurants in the area and the portions were filling.
author: Kellan M.

description:
12 raw oysters for $14 Happy Hour. The Cioppino. The Shellfish Combination en papillote. All moderately delicious -- but the raw oysters were definitely the best of what we ordered. Ambiance, decor, service (our server was so nice), mood.. everything was great. The prices knocked me off my chair, however -- but hey, you only live once, right? Might as well spend it with good food.

All in all, it was pretty decent food for the price. It's a good restaurant, but would I return? Unlikely, because I wasn't truly wowed by anything except the bill at the end.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I really believe they simply were tired of preparing, cooking and serving Chinese food and so while sitting around the table after hours, complaining about their lot in life the owners quite suddenly and without ever looking back decided, "Hey, let's give European food a go."

What Hyde Street did to Sole Meuniere is a disgrace.  I will never know if the sole was good or not good, fresh or not fresh as the sos Meuniere was really, really, really bad.

I ran out the door, down the street, screaming at the night.
author: Jay D.

description: So I'm giving this place four stars because it is Stormy's absolute go to joint for raw oysters. She passes over every other place in town for the quality here. I ate steak which was very workman like for a seafood joint.
author: Duane H.

description: Best happy hour in town! We live in the neighborhood and try to get here as much as possible. Oysters are always super fresh and delicious and priced very reasonably. Friendly servers and good deals on beer and wine also.
author: Eric S.

description: My mom and I were talking about scallops and decided to walk two blocks and give this place a try. While usually busy, that isn't much of a problem at 530pm. The restaurant has a cute wooden nautical theme with fish on the walls and boats. We tried the bacon wrapped scallops and pan seared garlic scallops. I preferred the bacon wrapped scallops but both were good. I have to admit it is a bit pricey for me. It was about $15 for 3 bacon wrapped scallops. Ouch. The pan seared scallops were more reasonably priced at 5 for $15.
author: Carlos A.

description:
O yeh! Good stuff.

Ambiance is classy and romantic. Cozy and happy. Open table reservations avaiable, for those who want to collect points. There are 2 dining rooms.

Tables are small but good enough for a close dinner with a romantic interest. Every night there is happy hour 5-7pm. Dozen oysters for $14. Normally it is around $30. This oyster platter : oysters come served on ice. 3 kinds of preselected oysters. 2 small cups of sauce: cocktail sauce and a sweet sauce. 

The pasta is creamy and delicious. I picked the pasta dish with baby scallops and shrimp. Shrimp tastes SO fresh. You can tell! 

Service is courteous and welcoming. Presentation also a plus.
author: Veranna N.

description:
First off I went here on a really cute date. It was has an adorable atmosphere, and is hidden on Hyde st. up in Nob hill. The ambiance was very business like yet romantic dim lantern lit tables. The service was terrific, every person working there had a sincere smile and cheer to their faces. The bread at first was so yummy, and I was hungry so I ate quite a bit and the House salad was just perfectly dressed with lots of greens. We had a glass of the 5 star Riesling and Pinto Grigio, very nice and went perfectly with the fish. 
I ordered the catch of the day, the seared Ahi Tuna and my date had the potato crusted salmon. 
The courses came at perfect timing, they waited until we were finished with salad before bringing meal and it was super hot!
Offered more bread and anything else multiple times!
The tuna was to die for the the sauce with it was a vinaigrette peppered sauce, AMAZING! With cheese potatoes and veggies, I ate the whole thing!
The salmon was so different and delicious, like a hashbrown cooked fish, with veggies.
Both dishes were served hot and looked beautiful, and perfectly sized portions, we ate everything on our plates and were just perfectly satisfied.

So basically, the food was amazing, the service was impeccable, and it was a perfect date! 

Will definitely go back and recommend to others! Great date night spot for any day of the week! (we went on Tues night)
author: Tracy W.

description: It was ok the service it's cool I guss the crab was not fresh and had no flavor at all next....
author: T t.

description: My favorite Russian Hill neighborhood seafood spot. Don't wait in line at Swan, go to Hyde Street! Best service in town, great oysters and happy hour, outstanding seafood dishes, good wine selection, Anchor Steam on tap...fun ambience and not too noisy. Great for groups, even kids.
author: Tracey K.

description:
A table of six for the happy hour on a Saturday afternoon at 5 before we go see a standup comedy nearby. There was one other table, nice, as we don't need to keep our noise down. Four of us got lucky on finding parking, yeah! We ordered 3 dozens of oysters and a bottle of sparkling rose while we wait for the other couple of friends to arrive. Needless to say, parking is a problem but it's kinda interesting to take a walk around the neighborhood. Old San Francisco architecture along with cable car running in between is very enjoyable.

Back to the restaurant, I would say it's very old school. I found it to be very comfortable with the wooden deco. The servers have that "whatever" attitude but yet very attentive and professional. They know their offerings well and recommended the perfect dishes to us.

Ok, three dozens of oysters at $14 each, great deal! First order, Fanny Bay, Sister Point, and Skookums. Everyone has their own favorite but the winners are the Sister Point and the Fanny Bay among the group and I totally agreed with them. Quotes from friends: Sister Point has the sweet after taste and the Fanny Bay is creamy. Again, at $14 a dozen, I wish I can do this each and every day.

After that we had a dozen of escargot, a couple of baked prawn, scallops dishes, steamed clams, and some sort of seafood salad. The escargots were... can you taste what an escargot tastes like? I'm not sure but I can tell you the texture was great and the sauce was pot on! The baked... seafood dish was yummy. There were a pool of sauce/oil left and we loved to use it as bread dipping. Sorry, the steamed clams were way too salty. Maybe we need to pair it with a stronger wine. As for the seafood salad, it's very refreshing and did its duty to wake us up before attending a performance at 7:30.

A little over two hours of happy happy happy hours with three bottles of wine, five dozens of oysters, and dish dish dish of apps. That got us very happy happy happy to attend yet another great performance at the Masonic Center. It's awesome!
author: Rio T.

description:
Food was excellent, would recommend their famous lobster bisque.  
We also had the oysters, excllent! 
My dinner was the snapper in parchment, excellent.
My son had the trout with the seafood stuffing....he loved the trout, not the stuffing.
My husband had the garlic shrimp, excellent.
It was an very good dining experience.
author: Lisa W.

description: My girlfriend and I might be Oysterholics. 5-7pm happy hour is a great place for $1 oysters, both local and import. They also had long neck clams, but I didn't care for them as much. Curiously, refill bread was lower quality than the initial complimentary bread. But I wouldn't hold that against them.
author: Adam D.

description:
As most of those before me with discriminating palates have said:

Go for the daily Happy Hour(s):
5-7pm, $12 for a dozen oysters.
              $2.50 beers

The rest of their menu isn't terribly well executed, but the oysters 'n beer or wine @ happy hour prices are a great way to kick off the night.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: I had stuffed prawns with crab and lobster: talk about the ultimate prawn! Loved the lobster bisque as well. Creme brulee was perfect. A very cozy place to dine in the city. Wait staff is friendly, attentive, and warming. Always a good experience here. Yumm!
author: Briget P.

description:
I came here with a group of 6 for their "Happy Hour." In my mind, Happy Hour goes hand-in-hand with a loud, boisterous, and happy vibe. However, this is NOT the case with Hyde Street Bistro. Only one table was occupied when we arrived around 6. While I don't eat oysters, my friends ordered two dozen of assorted ones to eat. Our server was well versed in oysters and was able to explain each different one to us thoroughly. Since I wasn't going to eat, I decided on a bowl of lobster bisque. The soup was very tasty, flavorful, and something that I would highly recommend!

Overall, I wouldn't suggest stopping by for Happy Hour unless you're craving oysters and a quiet place to eat.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I don't know how this place gets so many good reviews. I was completely unimpressed with the food-- The oysters seemed not fresh, and the seafood salad was underwhelming. I am a huge seafood fan and eat it constantly so I am truly confused as to why some of these rave reviews-- maybe we came in the night before new inventory came in. The lobster bisque was completely disgusting (think minced lobster bits in a bowl of lukewarm cream)- I couldn't even manage to take a third bite. I won't go back, but if I did I would probably try the papillote since every review seems to suggest that it's the best thing there. 

Still gonna give it two stars because I loved the atmosphere (I'm from New England and a marine history junkie)-- I loved the charts of ships and sailor's knots in the bathroom and all of the ships around the restaurant. Service was a little frantic and we never knew who to ask for anything. One guy, I think his name was Johnny, was pretty awesome during our couple brief interactions.
author: Alisa B.

description: The service was so slow we contemplated just walking out without paying. My partner loved his oysters. Everything else was boring and bland.
author: Mark S.

description: If Hyde Street Seafood is in your neighborhood, I'd say it's worth a try but I wouldn't go out of your way to try it if it's not. You know it's not the best meal when the bread and butter was your favorite. The ceasar salad was a let down and the clams in the seafood platter were extremely hard to swallow. Everything else was good but if you're looking to really indulge in some great seafood, there's many other SF spots to check out over this one.
author: Roya P.

description:
In New York, if there were a place that had an oyster special from 5-7 pm every day (even the weekends), it would be crowded! Not so here. I came here on a Saturday for their happy hour special - $12 for a dozen oysters. There was practically no one in the restaurant! I decided to get an even sampling of the three oysters that were part of the happy hour. The oysters included some from DC, grassy oysters, and kumamoto oysters. Amazing! They were fresh and beautifully shucked. No pieces of shell in the oyster juice. I couldn't believe there was no one on line for this place or the fact that it was so cheap. Maybe Swan Oyster took all their business? 

The decor is pretty formal - there are tablecloths. However, I was dressed in jeans and a t-shirt and didn't feel too out of place. They also give you bread with your oysters. The bread is nothing to rave about. Instead, the bread was rather boring and stale, but, hey, you are not there for the bread. 

So, come by for happy hour! It's a steal!
author: Stacy T.

description:
I came here last night and ordered a pretty good amount of food

Ordered:
Dozen Raw Oysters
Lobster Bisque
Steamed Mussels
Cioppino 

The oysters were pretty good, nothing really to hate on here

the lobster bisque was kind of bland and didn't really have any lobster taste

the steamed mussels were excellent and the sauce it came in was delicious!

the cioppino was mediocre, nothing to go crazy on here.

Overall the service was good and the food was decent. If you visit this place, try the mussels! The rest of the items were just whatevs
author: Steven C.

description:
love it!  love the ambiance and the menu.  I had the chioppino and its deliciouis.  Also had the raw clam and its pretty fresh.  The only thing is I was a bit disappointed with their dessert menu.

Overall, good place, will return.
author: Kathy C.

description:
Wish I could give a better review because the server was extremely nice and well-meaning, but the food was not up to par.

Bread: toasted cheap whitey
Cioppino: watery tomato paste + unfresh fish
Oysters: decent but past prime

Not coming back, but wish this family business the best.
author: Mandy H.

description:
The ambiance is 4 stars, I like the natural wood and nautical theme.  Plus you can't beat the cute neighborhood feel of Hyde Street.  So SF-y.

The food was merely ok.  I had the lobster bisque which was pretty yummy, my dining companions had the cioppino (we've all had better, go to sotto mare in north beach instead for the real deal), garlic crab (we've all had better, go to r&g lounge), and oysters (standard).  

The service was 2 stars at best.  Upon entering the restaurant, they were pretty unfriendly when I inquired about our reservation to be seated.  Their response was "people are paying and on their way out, just wait a little."  Our food took forever to arrive and the entire dinner was pretty prolonged.  Thankfully, our dinner party was having a good time in conversation.  Other tables were not so pleasantly patient, we overheard another table complain loudly about the long wait and poor service.  Awkward!

Overall, probably a good enough place to bring in tourists on July 4, but I wouldn't go back for the food.
author: Angie Y.

description: Awesome spot for taking mom - nice dinner, great service and great seafood. It's right in the sweet spot as to ambiance - nice but not stuffy or overdone.
author: Derek S.

description:
My friend and I came here for Happy Hour while we were visiting SF. Thanks, Yelp, for the recommendation! This is such a cute restaurant! They have an amazing deal on great oysters during HH (12 for $12) and my friend was overjoyed. We also ordered their Lobster Bisque and Clam Chowder. So good! They have a list of drinks available at a great price during HH and we took advantage of that! 

When we're back in SF, we'll definitely stop by for happy hour again!

-RM
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Another gem in Russian Hill found... Thank you tiny little datey restaurant for being the answer to my ever-so-terrible indecisive nature. The chefs here know how to cook their seafood, and it is simply delicious.

Stuffed prawns with lobster/crab/scallops are just as awesome as they sound. The bearnaise sauce it comes in is equally rich and decadent. I also tried the grilled swordfish which was a big mouthful of buttery goodness. I loved every bite of this meal down to the perfectly cooked vegetables (even the brussel sprouts!). 

The atmosphere was quaint, the service was friendly and attentive, and the location is convenient for the neighborhood. This place is the perfect place for a date, to catch up with friends, to bring visiting family...basically an all around knockout of a restaurant.
author: Samantha R.

description:
I can't believe that I've lived a block and a half away from this place for the last 6 months, and I haven't tried it until last week when my sister was in town.

12 oysters for $12 (during happy hour, weekdays from 5-7PM).  It doesn't get much better than that.

We also ordered the seafood fettuccine with creamy white wine sauce.  Mmmmm.

Good. 

Servers were very helpful and nice.

Highly recommended!
author: Grace C.

description: OMG!  We arrive about 20min before they opened, 5 pm, so relaxed outside on bench waiting to go in.  We're early birds!!  About 5 min into our waiting a lovely lady asked us if we where going to be dining there and invited us in. We sat by the window. Food was phenomenal. Lobster soup and Raw oysters to start off with!  Our meals where then just as delicious. All seafood was fresh and cooked perfectly. Prices where reasonable. Service was top notch. Best meal of our whole trip!  When I'm back in town, I'll be returning for another meal!!
author: Sara C.

description: Nice small place. We had a reservation at 7:00 and the place was empty.  At 7:30 the place was full.  The scallops and salmon were both really delicious.
author: Mike M.

description:
If I can manage to come here TWICE in one weekend.. I really must love it.

Was here on a Friday and Saturday for happy hour with $1 oysters and $3 buck beers on tap! How can you go wrong!? And you can't.  Go with the Steamboat ones if you can.. Big ole monster oysters!

Also the Seabass in the En Papillote is fresh, flavorful, and delish.  For someone who isn't big on veggies, veggies steamed in this little pocket of goodness will make you think twice.

Give it up to Johnny... He's the best!
author: Natalie G.

description:
We came here because my partner's parents were in town from the east coast and they wanted to get some good seafood.  I searched yelp and found Hyde St. Seafood House and Raw Bar and though it was a good place to take them.

We had a somewhat large party since they were meeting my parents for the first time.

Easy to get to, right off the Muni bus line from Powell.

We started off with the oysters, which were actually really good.  A bit pricey but I felt it was a special occasion.

The staff was really friendly and always checked on us multiple times and always brought plenty of bread.

I got the seafood combo (Prawns, escolar and scallops) which was okay but nothing to rave about.  The prawns were pretty good but the scallops were a bit over cooked and mushy.  The Escolar was cooked well and was alright but everything was covered in a buttery sauce, which overpowered the flavor of the food.  It also came with some standard veggies on the side which were basically steamed, nothing fancy.

Everyone else seemed to have the same sentiment with their dishes.  They were okay but nothing out of this world.

In the end, Hyde Street Seafood House and Raw Bar has great staff but the atmosphere seems a bit dated and don't seem to be a very hip place to be for the younger crowd.  I understand that it's core customers are not Gen-Y folks like myself looking for food and atmosphere with out-there fusion foods with great plating presentation.  I was also in the mood for a cocktail but they only had beer and wine.  We were actually having a pretty good time and finishing up our meal with coffee when we were asked to leave because there were other people waiting.  I hate it when people ask us to leave, its not like we were loitering around for hours and our bill was almost $300 with tip.

-1 star for the standard food that didn't really "wow" us
- 1 for the atmosphere and we were asked to leave after we had finished our meal
author: Kameron K.

description:
Awful, awful, awful.  
1- says full bar on Yelp, no full bar.
2- They're know for the En Papillote, and it was horrible.

Let me just say, the oysters were fresh and tasty.  Aside from that the food was AWFUL!  I had the seafood en papillote.  The mussels were mushy, clams chewy, shrimp rubbery and there was a burnt smell that was permeating the food.  And it was bland.  No salt.  I ate about 3 bites and pushed it aside.  Nobody came see what the problem was or say anything about a full plate of food being cleared away.  What a disappointment.
author: Heather S.

description:
Probably the only place open on Labor Day in a five block radius, because there were people literally spilling out the door.  

They seated us at the bar which was great, but since it was so crowded and they were so overbooked, service was slow and inattentive.  The food was good - the cioppino was rich and tasty, but the sea bass en papillote could have definitely used more seasoning.  I don't know how a restaurant runs with just three servers even on a regular night, but they were absolutely falling apart by the time we left.
author: Kevin C.

description: Came here tonight with 2 girlfriends and LOVED it. Happy hour oysters were $14 a dozen and delicious! High quality oysters. Then we ordered the lobster bisque and crab, and they were YUM. I am a big seafood eater, and quite picky about the quality. The service was amazing as well, very accommodating and fast. Will definitely come back here soon!!!
author: Winnie L.

description: Do not go here if you are hungry. The service is slow. And by slow I mean you may never eat after you order. Our waiter was extremely rude the entire way through, despite our appetizer taking OVER AN HOUR to get, and our food almost two hours. No, this is not an exaggeration. We were in the restaurant for over two hours, and the only reason why we did not want out is because the boyfriend does not get en fuego as I do. The rude staff was insult to injury. The food alone would get 2 stars, but we will never, ever be back.
author: Laura W.

description: I got the cajun scallops and prawns, and it was amazing, probably better than any cajun food I've had before, however, for 21 dollars I got 4 prawns and 4 scallops, that's it. Tasted great but dang 21 bucks for 8 small pieces of fish, kind of a rip off, and plus It wasn't very filling, add more prawns and scallops and it's worth the money.
author: Brandon M.

description:
My second experience at this place was somewhat less positive than the first. Our waiter had some language barrier issues, and even though the place was less full than when we were last there, the service was less attentive.

The appetizers were again quite yummy, as was the soup, but the entrees (particularly my friend's swordfish) were meh meh meh. My en papillote was the only interesting thing.
author: Lynae Z.

description: Really cute atmosphere and decor, but I was disappointed in the quality of the food for the price.  Maybe it's a lesson to only order the seafood, but my boyfriend's porkchop was pretty gristle-y and the texture indicated that it was not freshly cooked, like it was maybe microwaved. To charge over $20 for the dish seemed excessive. My stuffed shrimp were tastier but my potatoes were also tough, tasted like they'd been cooked a few days ago then microwaved.  Maybe I watch too much Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares, but at this price point, freshly cooked food is expected. I probably won't be back despite the charming location overlooking the Cable Car line.
author: Jasmin P.

description:
What a cute & sweet place. Nice decor, sweet service, host & bus-lady! Seems like family ran/owned. But the food & menu will impress you as if it's a fancy old-fashion seafood house. If you indulge & love fresh seafood/shell fish as much as I do, this can be your regular spot. 

The $1 oyster happy hour is a major reason to check this place out. The lobster bisque is yummy & lots too. I had some bake shell fish dish, while the bf had fish & lobster. Both were delicious! Definitely leaves you craving for more. In fact, I craved it the next day. Good food = happy walk home. Mindful, the bill will cost more than Red Lobster. :)
author: Yum Y U M.

description: Nice Ambiance, quick/responsive service, and good oysters!  Yum.   Ordered the oysters for happy hour, Salmon, and Bisque.  Enjoyed them all =)
author: Ben S.

description:
So my gal and I have been craving oysters since we got back from NOLA where we had some amazing food at the Acme Oyster House. She suggested this place having been there before and knowing that during happy hour the beers are cheap and the oysters are only $12 a dozen. I had read some of the reviews and was very excited for the oysters and the lobster bisque.

We ordered 2 dozen assorted oysters which we staggered and they were amazing! Fresh, clean and soooooo flavorful. I could have eaten another 2 dozen. The lobster bisque was to die for.
