description: awesome again,,,,as always.  the jalapeno sea bass is the best entre in the city and the lobster bisque is more lobster than bisque.  dont forget the key lime pie or bread pudding (it should come with a defibulator!) both were great.
author: Jim K.

description: So my boyfriend and I went here for dinner on Wednesday night. This place is such a tourist trap! I've lived here 2 years and i feel like i might as well have eaten at Fisherman's Wharf! We started with the crab cakes.....barely bigger than golf balls and bland. I had the Cajun shrimp and scallops....they were ok but there was definitely sand bits throughout. My boyfriend had the stuffed prawns, which were good for the first few bites, but became very buttery/rich and just a pile of mush in your mouth by the end. Service was very good, but not enough to make up for a $75 meal that was bleh.....definitely wont go back.
author: laury g.

description:
Service was severely lacking. We had to request water on multiple occasions. The waitstaff was kind but inatentive. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. I had their mixed seafood fettucini and a half dozen of bc oysters. My food was very tasty though.the fettucini was no better than what id expect from a chain restaurant. The oysters were served with the normal fixings and were tasty while well presented and very fresh. Let's face it though, how hard is it to do oysters right. They would have shined out if I could have orderred 2 or 3 and had the taste,snack that I was really looking for. The place was cute with maps on the wall. For the prices of the meals and the particularly non busy place the lack of service was inexcusable.
The chocolate cake was very rich, so much so that the person who orderred it could not finish it providing me a chance to taste it. It had a crunchy crust that was pleasantly inexpected.
The cajun scallops were very good, large and plump. The spices were true to form but I couldn't help but feel they would have been better lightly marinated to provide a deeper flavour. Paticularly for the shrimp in the dish as they did not take on any of the flavor.
I didn't get to try the dungenus crab pot pie but I did try the puff pastry, it was well made, but standard fare.
Place would have gotten a 4 if it weren't for the service., but would need a lot of work and originality to hit 5
author: H B.

description: nice stuffed shrimp, good atmosphere.  local favorite.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Great happy hour special!  $12 for a dozen oysters and $2.50 beers.  Perfect place to start off before going to a dinner reservation somewhere else.
author: LT B.

description: I joined Yelp just so I could write this review. I eat out probably ten times a week between lunch and dinner, and this was the very first time EVER I simply could not eat both my starter and my entree. I mean, not a lick. Usually I'll just pick at bad food and avoid returning to a place, but the arrogance, bad service, and bad food were so egregious i had to comment to the manager, when i finally found him. Turns out he didn't care. It went like this: We started out loving the neighborhood and feeling lucky we found such a nice, charming place with an amazing menu. It was Monday night and not very busy, and we were seated right away. That's when it went bad. The host/server/manager disappeared for 20 minutes before taking our drink order. OK, that was a long 20 min. but not the end of the world...my date ordered the seabass, i ordered the roast dungenous crab, and we split a green salad. After another 20 min. or so, the salad came without much dressing, so i asked for more on the side. It came about 10 min. later, and i quickly dumped it on my salad as i was starving. Too bad it was not dressing, but pure oil. Salad ruined, I tried in vain to get ahold of someone to get a new one. Never happened. The next time we saw anyone was after another interminable wait and they were delivering our entrees. I mentioned the salad but the server was 100% unconcerned. No apology, no offer of a replacement or refund. Nothing. Now we're really starving, and I feasted my eyes on the $35 crab, which was about the size of my hand. No kidding. It honestly looked like a slightly oversized soft-shell crab, and worse, had been "roasted" so long the brittle shell and rubbery "meat" would not have appealed to a starving alley cat. I was really hungry but this was ridiculous. Another long wait and finally the manager is tackled, but merely looks at me like i am crazy and cannot see anything wrong with the speciman before me. He takes it away, without apology, and says he'll take it off the check. What a sport. My date's seabass is ok, a little dry, but the whole service experience has soured her by this time as well and we ask for the check. The guy is just shaking his head and disappears, during which time an asian lady appears and tells me she checked the crab and it was fine. They were actually arguing with me during service (or lack thereof) about my perception of how a crab should be cooked! Again, I have never rejected an entire meal in my life before...and even with the worst service never have left less than 10% tip. Check came ($40, for what? I didn't even look...) left 5%, and joined yelp. I know places have bad days, but really, at least apologize to the customer for a bad experience. One star for location.
author: justin w.

description: My sister-in-law is in town so wanted to take her out to somewhere good.   Since she likes raw oysters, searched on Yelp for suggestions and good eats and finally decided on Hyde Street Seafood House and Raw Bar.  And it was a great choice!   We started with raw oyster and clams and they were fresh and sweet.  We have a party of five and decided to order a few Starters to share first.   We ordered the Lobster bisque, Escargot with Garlic Herb Butter, Steamed Clams, Garlic Roasted Petite Maine Lobster Tail, which were all DELICIOUS.  Afterwards, we ordered three more Entrees to share.  I got to admit, the Entrees were not too impressive.  The Starters were a lot more appetizing and tasty.   Thus, I give it an overall four stars.
author: Maggie L.

description:
did not like any of the food there.  it seemed tasteless and not that fresh.  and it isn't cheap!

i didn't like the wait staff, they seemed grumpy.

won't be going back by choice.
author: tc h.

description: I'm a big seafood fan.  The lobster bisque is sooo goood.  You have to order it if you make it there.  It is creamy, just make sure you don't order another cream sauce dish.  I skipped on the oysters as I just had them recently, and went with the cherry stone clams.  They were good and one of the few places I can find them.  Service was excellent!  I will be back.
author: OC R.

description: Great happy hour .  Nice service and menu.  Definately one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants.
author: Liz M.

description: If there was an option for 0 stars...that's what I would choose for this place.  One word...HORRIBLE...to describe the food, service, atmosphere.  My fiance and I felt like we were in some cheesy eatery at Fisherman's Wharf.  We would have been able to overlook all this if either the food or service was decent...BUT we ended up spending $160 for cheap, 'can' tasting lobster bisque, soft-shelled crab that was overly fried and sat too long before coming to us that it was soggy!  It took us over 1 HOUR to get our appetizers and the waitstaff was ambivalent to it all.  Finally we just asked to wrap up our main course and dessert to go!!!!  This place is maybe one of the WORST places I have ever eaten and will NEVER go back...would rather have a big Mac at Mickey D's!
author: Marsha L.

description: I love the lobster bisque here. The desserts are good and pretty cheap. Go for the happy hour, oysters and cheap beer. It's my favorite restaurant in SF.
author: K M.

description: We were visiting SF and were in the mood for some good seafood.  Saw this place in the San Francisco magazine and decided to try it.  The food is okay.  The stuffed trout was just okay but the lobster bisque was very good.  The ambiance is non existent and service was just so so. The stuffed shrimp was good.  The price was okay, not too expensive. Place needs to be painted and the whole place redecorated.
author: Mar S.

description: FANTASTIC! My boyfriend and I love this place. Great seafood, reasonable prices, and a really great sailing sort of atmosphere. Johnny and Sofia are great, always friendly and welcoming. We are definite regulars of this place!!! The chowder and lobster bisque are the best we've had (and we are new englanders!).
author: Geri G.

description: I came here on a recent Tuesday night for the happy hour special.  Draft beers for $2.50 and a dozen oysters for $12.  Can't really beat that.  Especially when there are tons of seats and live jazz!  There were lots of other things on the menu, but we just had oysters and soup.  Fellow yelpers did not steer me wrong, the lobster bisque was DELISH!  One of my friends said it was too salty for her, but I disagree, I thought it was perfect.  Another friend had the clam chowder, which I did not taste but she said it was great.  The bread was yummy too.  The only thing I would skip next time I go is the baked oysters.  I was really excited about them, having had yummy ones at the Buckeye in Marin, but these did not taste all that great to me.  The raw oysters however, were fantastic.  All three types tasted super fresh, and the selection of different types was fun.  I tried to see if I could actually taste a difference (I could, and preferred whichever ones were the largest).  A great, and relatively inexpensive, way to gorge myself on oysters - I will def be back here!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
food was delicious.  went with 2 friends and got the house salad (perfect dressing), the lobster bisque (delish and delicate), whole dungeness crab (mmmmmmm), mahi mahi (perfect), and a chocolate dessert.  

the setting was romantic but not cheesy.  

brian was the best server ever:  always there 10 seconds before you were going to ask for him.  and he gave us complimentary dessert.  

overall exactly what we were looking for.  wouldn't change a thing.  perfection!
author: Maren G.

description:
My friend and I didn't make a reservation but we were seated within 15 min on a Saturday night.  The atmosphere was great, but not for a romantic date for sure.  It's really loud inside..especially when people had too much wine they started yelling and clapping. Anyway, despite all that noise, we enjoyed our lobster bisque, lobster ravioli and sea bass en papillote. The lobster bisque was on the heavy side, but the bits of lobster meat was a pleasant surprise. Not sure if it's a good idea to order lobster bisque and lobster ravioli on the same night, but the ravioli was equally delicious.  Sea bass was moist and cooked just right, the veggies on the side were pretty good.  I regret not trying their oysters, as my friend doesn't eat anything raw.  Waiters were polite but they're definitely short of waiters.  Would highly recommend large parties to make reservation and be prepared to spend a good 20 minutes to find parking.
P.S. Skip the bread. It's not that great.
author: Winnie Y.

description: My boyfriend and I ate at this restaurant last night. After reading all of the yelp reviews, we decided to give it a try and found the experience about average. The food was decent - we both had the lobster bisque though it was super rich in a heavy cream sauce with generous bits of lobster (I am not big on heavy cream). We also each had one of their signature paper wrapped dishes. I was a bit disappointed when 2 of my 4 mussels were closed up (you should not eat mussels or clams that have not opened up). Though the shrimp were huge and very tasty (this was the shellfish plate). He had the escarole (butterfish), which was very rich and filling - you will not leave hungry. The wait staff were a bit inattentive as well and the time between dishes was a bit longer than usual as was the wait for the bill. The ambiance was great as other yelpers mention. Overall I give this restaurant a 3 - food was not to-die-for, prices were OK ($80 for 2 with a glass of wine each), service was so-so, and ambiance was good.
author: Shannon W.

description: the ambience here is somewhat lacking (or maybe the decor is just a tad random...), but the fish is good.  go for anything en papillote.  i thought the oysters were okay at best, but the prices are definitely right.
author: nicole l.

description:
mmm oysters..

def. hidden gem that i found on yelp last year. went for a cozy dinner for 2, which this place is great for. the service is warm and friendly, esp. sophia! go for their happy hour from 5-7 everyday. and i like it better than hog island.

-1 stars cuz this guy i used to whatever with started taking everyone and their mama there. (technically not hyde's fault for being so good but whatever.)
author: joanna u.

description: If you like seafood, then you need to eat here, if you don't like seafood, then you shouldn't (obviously). My boyfriend and I went here for New Year's Eve dinner- they had prix-fixed menu for only $60 which included appetizer, entrree, and dessert. Considering what they had on the menu, it was a great deal- I ended up having the caesar salad with dungeness crab meat, filet mignon and jumbo shrimp, and key lime pie while my bf had smoked salmon, whole maine lobster, and creme brulee.  Everything was tasty, came out promptly, service was great- I think there were only 3 servers for the whole restaurant so they were running around, but they were attentive enough for my liking.  Anyways, this place is definitely a good place to go to if you want good food, nice atmosphere, and a good price without the uppity attitude.
author: cynthia l.

description: This was an unpretentious, cozy place with an awesome menu if you are a seafood lover. The food was very good, and despite what I read here, the service was prompt. I went with my wife- We started with a couple of beers- and then we had the Cajun Shrimp and Scallops along with the Lobster Bisque- Both were quite good, though we both really liked the cajun dish- Then we moved on to the Caesar for two- Very standard but very yummy- Then we finished with the Ahi Tuna and the Ginger Scallops- Both were totally yum- we did have desert and I had a glass of wine- Overall quite good and we left with the bill about $100 with tip so not bad-  Good place !
author: kevin e.

description: Great food, excellent and nice staff. Kind of 'touristy' but I'd go back again!
author: Andrew S.

description: I love to eat seafood and this is one of my favorite place to eat at. When going there I love to eat their fish, chapino and lobster bisque. All of the waiters and waitress are really nice and friendly. The decore of the place is really nice to. They make the place look like a place you would eat at the Pier. Parking is a little hard to find, but it is all worth it to it at. LOBSTER BISQUE is soooo good to eat though.
author: Melanie T.

description: A real find. Fabulous staff and owner. Friendly...they will welcome you back and remember your name. Fresh seafood, try the special papillote. Best lobster bisque in the city.
author: Sara R.

description: This is a great place to stop by in the neighborhood after work.  Came by with some friends and shucked some $1 oysters.  Most places that have HH oysters usually only have one choice of oysters that are $1.  This place has at least 3.  Additionly, unlike Hog Island, their HH oysters are offered M-F.  Beer on the tap is cheap too.  This is place is quiet and you don't have to fight for a seat if you know what I mean.
author: Hoang D.

description: I'm sure why everyone says the service is bad. To me it was good.  The restraunt it's self was interesting. the bottom half was dark and empty, but the top half was crowded and lively. I must say though, we sat in a booth next to a loud group and we could hear their convo. And finally the food. It was mediocre. Not bad, but nothing specail.
author: Josh B.

description: All that I have to say is this -- I thought that our server made this experience a fantastic one.  I thought the oysters were excellent, with a combination of three different types, and for only $12 a dozen.  The rest of our meal was average for San Francisco, but it didn't matter because our server, Twan, made us feel like we were in a four star restaurant anyways.  We happened to be celebrating our anniversary and they brought us out a surprise dessert which I really wasn't expecting, but remembered I had mentioned it on my OpenTable reservation.  I feel like this never happens anymore -- genuine and real service that makes you feel good that you walked into a place.  Nice job Twan - we will definately come back because you were so professional and willing to take the extra steps needed to make the guest feel welcome.
author: Denise O.

description: This place - has wonderful food and service, it is set in a very interesting room with fabulous maps spread over the entire wall. If you life seafood and fish - this is consistently a great place to eat.
author: Tracey M.

description: I can see why perhaps the happy hour would negate the reasons for my complaints about this place.  If you did not have to wait to be seated and were only ordering oysters and wine, this could be a decent neighborhood place.  However, a sit-down dinner here is a bad call.  We were seated well after our reservation, and they seated two other parties before us that waltzed in late for their reservations.  None of the entrees were anything to write home about and the waiter accidentally plunged his fingers in my friend's beer and had to pause and think about whether or not he should offer to replace it.   And when I say pause, I mean a good, long, silence-creating, glances-exchanged pause.  Not my idea of stellar service.  I consider myself stubborn, so I will still attempt the happy hour and try to give the benefit of the doubt.
author: MB B.

description: service took FOREVER! waited a long time to get a table-even though not busy.  then took forever to take our order. will go back to try happy hour though- $1 oysters may be their redeeming quality?
author: Grace D.

description: you MUST have the lobster bisque! it is sooooo good. i can eat that all day, every day. i love all types of seafood so this is my kind of place. the service is excellent - incredibly friendly and nice people. don't bother driving here, you'll never find parking. ever.
author: sandra l.

description: My craving for good, fresh, well prepared seafood on this particular night led me to this place based on overall ratings.  An anniversary dinner my partner and I could only laugh about at the end of the meal by concocting make believe stories about the possible reasons for such sub par food and the restaurant's history.  The oysters were good, the shell pieces, from improper shucking I imagine, added texture which is different.  We then shared the petite, like Kate Moss petite, lobster tail which had a wonderfully chewy consistency.  The garlic butter sauce that came with it made for great bread dipping!  The prawn/ scallop app was over done and doused with cayenne which actually complemented the wine nicely.  While waiting for entrees, all we could do was smile. Another DING! romantically resonates from the kitchen indicating our final course was probably ready.  We both accept our fate like Romeo and Juliet, because despite this tragedy, we were still in love.
author: mystery m.
